Kathy and Rick are easy going and genuine. They made us feel at home. We enjoyed walking around their woodlands. Nearby Blackwater Wildlife Refuge was quiet and beautiful both for hiking and kayaking…we want to return in warmer weather.
Two things to note are the slow internet and no cooktop. I learned to use the countertop oven and microwave for cooking so we ate well!
We had a wonderful time at Kathy and Rick's place. So peaceful and yet close to adorable towns like Cambridge, Oxford and St. Michael's. Highly recommended. Would definitely return!
My time at Kathy's and Rick's apartment was lovely. They are warm, caring, and most hospitable. The unit is clean, homey, and well appointed. I look forward to my return visit.

You cannot find a better place to stay when visiting the Eastern Shore and the Blackwater Wildlife Refuge. I heard that there are lots of Wood Ducks on their pond in March so this would be a great time to visit. Kathy and Rick are wonderful hosts. The natural setting of the home is beautiful.
Rick and Kathy are the kind of people that make Air bnb great. this a fantastic place stay in a great area.. We recommend highly.
Unit was as described and Kathy and Rick were very welcoming and informative hosts.

The house and property was wonderful and a great retreat from a busy world. Great location near Blackwater and we enjoyed the biking and kayaking. Kathy and Rick were wonderful host. I would highly recommend this place for a quiet getaway.
Great quiet place to stay. Nice rooms and really nice people. I would encourage everyone to vacation there

My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed staying at Cathy & Rick's. All the reviews I pre-read before staying and the reviews are spot on. This stay was perfect. The property picture perfect. The hospitality was great. We were greeted with the most delicious muffins on kitchen table. Their suggestions of things to do and places to eat were taken. Blackwater wildlife Refuge Drive Through. Loved it. RAR Brewery. Loved it. Maryland Blue. Great. Visited Hoopers Island, Taylor Island. Saw several eagles, herons, turtles, egrets and deer. Great Trip. Great hosts.

Super clean and comfortable! What a lovely location! Rick and Kathy are so kind and attentive to detail...they make you feel like part of the family right from the start. For triathletes coming for a race, this is only 21 minutes from Gerry Boyle but gives you such a peaceful place to rest and get away from all the noise when sleep and rest are needed. There are quiet beautiful trails, a little pond and even a relaxing water feature to enjoy on this property. So pleased overall!

Wonderful hosts. Very knowledgeable about the area. Great attention to detail in a charming getaway.
Quiet and serene surroundings. We will visit again!

Everything was wonderful. Kathy and Rick are very welcoming and kind. They were thrilled to have two rambunctious kids run around and tolerable of all their shenanigans. The unit was just what we needed for our family of 4 for a quick two night stay. Lots to explore in the area and on their farm.

My three year old son and I had a lovely, peaceful weekend here. Kathy and Rick are wonderful, warm hosts and their property is beautiful. Kathy even made us a delicious cake and sent us home with extra slices! And Rick drove my son and me around the farm on an ATV. The space is spotless, comfortable and has everything you need. Highly recommended.

Not only are there great trees growing on Kathy and Rick's property, but our relationship with the place has evolved every step of the way. The nature, the birds, well-kept paths in the woods, the delicious cake of Kathy and the conversations with Rick - as warm and attentive hosts as rare!!! The rooms are well maintained and clean - we had a great rest here and would like to come back any time!!!

This place is a real gem-- if the hosts were my neighbors we'd be best friends!!! Fabulous property, lots to do and see in the area, extraordinarily clean and relaxing, great getaway!!! We will be back!
Enjoyed our time very much ... Rick and Kathy are great hosts!
It was one of the Best ABandB we have stayed in

This is a wonderful place to stay! Kathy and Rick are very friendly and helpful and the place is so comfortable, clean, and perfectly secluded within the trees. It is also a short distance away from the Blackwater Wildlife Refuge, the Harriet Tubman NPS Visitor Center, and the Harriet Tubman Museum, all of which I genuinely recommend. Rick can give you all kinds of info on the BWR, which I strongly suggest going to in the early morning hours, you will see all kinds of active wildlife. In between the sight-seeing I enjoyed the peace and quiet on the tree farm and took advantage of my time there to catch up on all my reading. Highly Recommended!
Great hospitality. Clean,spacious, comfortable. Fresh bakery made muffins were very satisfying.
A wonderful find on AirBnB. An exceptional location in every way, beauty in surrondings. the home, the hosts. Look no further.

We really enjoyed the stay. They welcomed us and gave us a lot information for our travel. You can enjoy beautiful voices of birds in the sweet garden. Actually that’s awesome. The room is completely clean and everything that we wants were there. You can visit to Ocean city or Assateague national seashore around 1 hrs. I definitely recommend to stay here.

Rick and Kathy are the warmest most welcoming hosts!
Their place is immaculate!
History surrounds their farm and the area… don’t miss this one!

Kathy and Rick are wonderful hosts. Their property is set back from the road and had many acres to explore. We stayed here with our kids (ages 5 and 10) and made excursions to the Harriet Tubman byway, Blackwater and Smith Island. I wish we had more time to just chill on the property.
Our kids loved visiting the chickens and Kathy & Rick invited them to help feed the birds which delighted our kiddos.
Th space itself is just as described, comfortable, and worked very well for our family. Be sure to wear closed toed shoes when walking the property in the evening for the sake of not getting bitten too much by mosquitoes
A great and reliable place to stay! Cleanliness and felt like home! Hosts Kathy and Rick are fantastic

It was truly a pleasure not only staying at Rick's and Kathy's tree farm but also hanging out with Rick (sorry we missed you Kathy!).
The property
The tree farm is a lovely place. There are walking trails and wild life right on the property. There are feeders for birds and squirrels all around. The backyard has a shaded gazebo area with swinging bench and frog pond where I spend hours just sitting around watching the many cardinals, hummingbird, goldfinch, crows and squirrels. Even spotted a fox from far away! Be sure to bring your binocular if you want to watch some birds (or if you're lucky Rick might have one around).
It's 4-5 minute's drive from the Maryland Blue restaurant, awesome seafood place, and not too far from Blackwater refuge, Harriet Tubman Museum, and Blackwater Adventures (kayak rental).
The owners
Rick was a great host, on the first day he greeted us when we arrived and told us what amenities are available on his property and what points of interests are in the surrounding area, even telling us how to navigate at the Blackwater refuge. On the second day after our adventure we came back to the property and he spent some time chatted with us and sharing a beer with us, telling us about the history of the property and the refuge (that Rick is heavily involved), which we were only all too happy to hear about. He even took me on a ride on his John Deere Gator (utility vehicle) to show me around the property so if I wanted to drive around myself later - which he very nicely offered for me to do all on my own - I can be familiar with the surroundings. We just really appreciated Rick's time - this is why we travel, to see new places and meet new people! We think this is our best AirBnB experience (and we have a fair amount).
You can't go wrong with this place!

Wonderful hosts who go well above and beyond in their hospitiality. Saw many cool birds, kayaked, saw the trails, and explored many great recommendations from Kathy. Rick gave us a great background on the history of the property. Unique and memorable stay. Thanks again Kathy and Rick!
Great house, fantastic hosts, good location, delicious scones. I couldn't have been happier to stay with Rick and Kathy.

Just an amazing place! Rick and Kathy are very warm and welcoming. This was the first airbnb we stayed at, and many stays and years later, Madison Nature Getaway is still the best airbnb we have ever experienced. If you're fortunate, you'll even find some of Kathy's blueberry scones on the table- simply the best we have ever had!
This is a great spot. Kathy and Rick are very accommodating. The space was clean and nicely decorated. My favorite part was being able to walk through the woods. Recommend a stay.

We booked this trip hoping for a quiet family escape for my husband’s birthday. We got so much more out of this experience!! Everything in the guest house was immaculate and well thought out. The hospitality was unmatched. There were guides to the area in the house, but Rick and Kathy also provided valuable guidance. Kathy even baked a cake and provided a decorating kit for our young daughters. Our girls were absolutely obsessed with the farm—it felt like going to stay with our favorite aunt and uncle. It was also a beautiful location for nature lovers. We could have easily stayed for a week and had plenty to explore.

Besides being absolutely wonderful hosts, Kathy & Rick provide a beautiful cottage, as well as, a spectacular piece of land full of opportunities to reconnect with nature. The living space was very comfortable and clean. Kathy & Rick are extremely helpful & very knowledgeable about the area. Don’t hesitate at all about spending time here, the memories will be priceless:)

Kathy and Rick are exceptional hosts! Look forward to their warm and generous hospitality. Their Nature's Rest is a destination unto itself, not just a place to stay. Songbirds, waterfowl and wildlife abound in and around their wooded retreat. There are scenic walking trails in and out of a wooded forest with a beautiful pond, complete with a hanging wooden porch swing to sit and take in the peaceful view while listing to chirping frogs and singing birds. Just outside their home is a covered, but open gazebo with vintage iron chairs and glider, surrounded by bird feeders and a garden with a babbling fountain. Great place for coffee, reading or to sit and have some great conversation with your hosts and hear stories about the farm and how it came to be be. Kathy's baked goods are also a welcome treat to enjoy. Was just looking for a quiet place to stay for a few days to enjoy some fishing nearby with a friend, but was truly impressed with all our hosts had to offer when we decided to spend the day at the farm one day because of windy weather. Planning a future visit with my wife.
Nice place and even better people!
Comfortable, private accommodations in a beautiful and peaceful setting. They greet you with open arms and fresh baked goods. Kathy and Rick are great hosts and great people.

This was our second time staying here and it was just wonderful as the first time. Very clean, cozy space. Was so nice to have a fire in the wood stove. The grounds are beautiful and serene! Kathy made us delicious pumpkin bread and blueberry scones, which we truly appreciated. Both she and Rick were gracious hosts. They share great information about the area and are so pleasant to talk with. Will definitely stay again, whenever we are in this area.
We had the BEST time at Kathy and Rick's and can't to go back! The suite is spacious and beautiful and is so very serene- it's just what we were lookingfor!

We loved this AirBnB! The guest space is attached to the main house, but it is entirely separate. We had our own entrance and porch swing. Inside, the main room is large. One half is a living room and the other half is a dining room with small kitchen (large fridge, microwave, small sink, drip coffee maker (with coffee, filters and sweeteners), dishes, silverware, napkins, placemats, towels, dish soap, etc.) The bathroom has one of those walk-in tubs that you see in magazines. We just used it as a shower. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The place is beautifully decorated and the temperature was easy to regulate. The property is as gorgeous as any nature park and we roamed around during the day and even at night under a star-studded sky. There are outdoor seating areas to enjoy the scenery and the many birds who dine at their bird feeders. The location is ideal for getting to Cambridge, Blackwater NWR, and other activities. Kathy and Rick could not be more attentive to what we needed/wanted. They are kind people and have interesting stories to tell. We had an outstanding time at this AirBnB.

A comfortable, beautiful sanctuary which allows you to just relax and wander peacefully. Kathy and Rick are excellent hosts and offer everything one could ask for. Even homemade baked goods awaited my arrival. Wonderful stay.

When you read everyone else's review of ABnB hosts that are all glowing - five star ratings, you aren't surprised to find a cute-as-a-button apartment that is clean-as-a-whistle, hosted by lovely friendly people. So, I won't go on and on of what a great stay this was. Kathy and Rick are as wonderful - in fact, even more than- they are described in everyone's reviews. We hope to go back in the spring to see the wood duck babies from the blind on the pond. How cool will that be! Oh yes, the warm blueberry scones are pretty sweet too!
Loved my stay with Kathy and Rick. Super clean, wonderful amenities and great hosts. I highly recommend.
Kathy and Rick are excellent hosts. They go above and beyond in making your stay excellent. Kathy’s blueberry scones are delicious 😋

Kathy and Rick are just great hosts and wonderful and accommodating people, with great tips on local activities and eating options. The apartment is roomy and private, and borders on their picturesque tree farm, which is rightly prized and a great haven for local wildlife. They are both active connecting people with nature, Rick particularly with nearby Blackwater NWR (a great place to see eagles and waterbirds). We were fortunate to sample Kathy's baking - literally the icing on the cake to a most enjoyable stay!

this Airbnb combines a lot of elements to make for a great product. the property itself is located within an active tree farm, and a wonderful private comfortable space for lodging. we arrived to a plate of fresh baked chocolate chip cookies, a lot of help in picking the best places to see and dine, and hosts which helped us delight in eating a dozen steamed Chesapeake Bay crabs. highly recommend staying with Kathy and Rick.

A very wonderful place. The farm was very picturesque, quiet and peaceful. It was close enough to town to go out to eat, but far enough to enjoy the peace and quiet of the country. Host were super helpful, easy going and friendly, like old friends. The accommodations, were clean, quiet and comfy.

Perfectly delightful. Kathy and Rick are such kind, welcoming people. Location is beautiful. I was in town for a family event, a wedding, so I did not have the time I wish I had to explore their farm, but that saves something to do next time, because I certainly plan on a next time. Charming place to stay. Cozy, yet plenty of room. Everything was spotless, and most comfortable. I could not have wished for things, from finding the location, to communication, to be easier. Highly recommend. Thank you so much Kathy and Rick, I shall return.
Rick and Kathy's place is a haven for nature and a great place to unwind.
Very nice couple. Very clean inside. The screened in patio offers a great space to eat/cook and relax. We will be renting again.

I don't even know where to begin, Rick and Kathy are some of the nicest people you will ever meet, they go above and beyond to make sure you are enjoying the maryland experience. There property is very beautiful and well managed, and the hospitality is unbelievable!

We had a wonderful weekend stay at Kathy and Rick's place! The apartment is a great place for a couple to stay--quiet and comfortable and in a beautiful location. We loved walking around the tree farm, relaxing at night in front of the wood stove while playing games, and exploring the area. Kathy and Rick were wonderful hosts who welcomed us and were available when we had questions, but also gave us lots of privacy. The apartment was very clean and COVID-safe with wonderful treats for breakfasts and snacks. We enjoyed hikes at Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge, exploring the Harriet Tubman Byway Tour (there's an app with an excellent audio guide), and eating outdoors at Portside Restaurant. Palm Beach Willie's also looked like a good safe outdoor option with music, though we didn't make it there this time. This would be a great area for cycling and paddling, too. We can't wait to come back and stay at Kathy and Rick's place!

Perfect Low-key Weekend Getaway...
We spent a weekend at Rick and Kathy’s. When we got there we were really impressed with the space. There were snacks put out for us and the fresh muffins Kathy put out were amazing. Immediately Rick and Kathy let our 6 year old feed the chickens that are running around which absolutely made his day. After that they took us on a ride around the farm on their gator (like an ATV) and then handed over the keys which was another highlight of the weekend as we took it out quite a few times while we were there. On the second day we drove over to the Spocott windmill and saw the windmill, the single room schoolhouse, and the blacksmith shop. We stopped at Emily’s produce and bought some fresh food and then we fished the pond on the farm. The pond is stocked with largemouth bass and fishing was such a fun experience. Rick and Kathy took us for another ride around the farm and talked about the history of it and then let our son plant a few trees which he loved. That night we sat around a fire with Rick and Kathy and talked about life and ate smores. By the end of the night our son was calling Kathy “Aunt Kathy.” Sunday morning we packed up and went biking at Blackwater Wildlife Refuge and headed home. Overall on the farm we saw turtles, caterpillars, chickens, deer, frogs, and fish. I can’t recommend enough that you book time to spend at this magical place, especially if you have children that are curious about the outdoors.

Kathy and Rick really are Super Hosts! They were very accommodating with our last minute booking (when the weather changed) and did their utmost, without being intrusive, to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. The farm is a wonderful place to relax and we loved the chickens and exceptional birdlife. There is plenty to do in the surrounding area and Kathy and Rick were helpful with suggestions and recommendations. We had no concerns about COVID - the place was spotless and there was appropriate social distancing at all times. Highly recommended.

Kathy and Rick are by far two of the most gracious, hospitable, and generous hosts we have encountered in our years on Air B&B. Their place is exceptionally clean, well located, and fun! Highly recommended. We will definitely be returning, and soon!

Beautiful, peaceful spot in a true Eastern Shore of MD atmosphere. Lovely little apt. attached to owners’ home, but with separate entrance and privacy. As this was our 1st venture away from home since Covid arrived, we wanted to feel safe and Kathy and Rick couldn’t have been more friendly and welcoming - we thoroughly enjoyed chatting with them, including when we ran into them at the local watering hole, Palm Beach Willie’s! But were never intrusive and even sent us on our way with some fresh eggs from their fun flock of hens. The living space was spotless and they are following all Air BandB safety guidelines to assure visitor comfort. Their wonderful tree farm is located very near Blackwater NWR, so if nature walks are a fave this spot is a gem. Snacks, fruit, yummy muffins, coffee, juices, and milk were all kindly provided. Not a full kitchen, but grilling is certainly an option and we found plenty of outdoor dining options, within 10-20 minutes (Cambridge is nearest town) We started each morning with a walk about the farm and then ventured farther into Chesapeake country for hiking, biking, and kayaking - it is a glorious part of the world for nature lovers.
In summer, be prepared for ‘skeeters- but it is worth it!
We truly hope to return because each season must be beautiful - and Kathy and Rick were so sweet!

We really appreciated the friendliness of our hosts Kathy and Rick. The location near Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge was great, very quiet, and private. The breakfast/snack goodies - cereals, freah fruit, milk, juices, and baked items were perfect and much appreciated. They have a lovey property as well, with birds, turtles and other wildlife. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, plenty of room for our family of four. If you’re looking for a quiet getaway in the Chesapeake Eastern shore, we recommend giving this a try.

Our family of four had an exceptional two night stay with Rick and Kathy. The greeting was warm, space private, immaculately clean, and beautifully decorated. They provided lots of good quality snacks, including milk, cereal, and coffee, high quality linens, and thoughtful touches we might have forgotten. Above all, the location was wonderful. Just 15 minutes from our kayaking tour in Blackwater Wildlife Preserve, and their farm itself was open for hiking, fishing, and wildlife spotting. My kids ( 9& 11) loved feeding chickens and touring the farm on Rick's Gator, and both have asked if we can go back for another stay this fall.

Amazing place and extraordinary services! Kathy and Rick are the best people to visit and rent their beautiful space. We had great time and we will visit them again! My husband and I recommend it to everyone who is looking to have a true rest. Great place! Thank you, Rick and Kathy for your warm hospitality!

Kathy and Rick are truly super hosts. Their generosity, helpfulness, and friendliness can't be beat. I was there when hurricane Isaias hit, and although the wind was fierce and the rain was pounding, I felt very safe in the extra-secure space they had built. I loved taking walks on their property and enjoyed getting to know them. It's a very special place!

The hosts Rick and Kathy cultivated a very special getaway in this beautiful part of the state. The tree farm offers a great opportunity to observe the local wildlife and has quick access to excellent food and day trips. Rick and Kathy are generous hosts and we look forward to cracking open the farm fresh eggs they sent us home with.

Kathy and Rick are extremely welcoming people and have a lot of BEAUTIFUL land to be explored while staying in a lovely little place connected to their house. They were very open to us and I consider them friends! Would 100% recommend staying here if you love nature and good country folks.

Kathy and Rick were the perfect hosts. This could not have been a more wonderful stay. Kathy and Rick were warm and friendly and the place is spacious, inviting, and sparkling clean! We are planning to go back!!!

This was the perfect spot for us to visit with our 2 year old.
We had high expectations after reading the other beaming reviews, and we were not disappointed. Kathy and Rick were amazing hosts who made us feel at home immediately. They made sure we were always comfortable, but it never felt like they were hovering. We enjoyed chatting with them, hearing about the farm and the surrounding area. Even before we got out of our car, they checked to be sure we were on the same page about wearing masks to be safe during the Corona virus pandemic. They even sent us home with some souvenirs.
The living space was sparkling clean and well decorated. We appreciated the little touches, the snacks and breakfast they provided, the bug spray (which we definitely needed in July), the fluffy towels, the comfortable bed, the brand new crib for our toddler, the rocking chairs looking out over the bird feeders . . .
We had a blast exploring the farm, too. Our toddler loved riding around in the Gator, walking around the pond, scoping for wildlife, and admiring Rick's tractors & backhoe. And especially feeding the chickens! We made good use of the provided grill and screened-in pavilion for dinner.
This is not a place where you'll find a bustling town or lots to do (though Cambridge is only about 20 minutes away), but if you're looking for a quiet getaway surrounded by nature, check it out! We visited the nearby Blackwater reserve, with a few hiking trails and a driving route. We rented a kayak to go out on the Little Blackwater River. We ordered crabs from Lindy's that were among the best we've ever had, and super reasonably priced.
Highly recommend!

We had a great time at Kathy and Rick's house! The place was sparkling clean and there are so many extra touches to make your stay more comfortable. Kathy and Rick are very welcoming and want to tell you about the area. We had fun exploring the property on their Gator and the breakfast and snack foods were a treat. For a bigger breakfast you can pick up a sandwich at Woolfords store. A great place to fish, kayak and relax, and dinner at Jimmie and Sook's was delicious.

Kathy and Rick's place is one of those rare discoveries that you will want to return to time and time again. Where to start? Communication prior to booking was great and they were happy to answer our questions about the area, what we might see and what we needed to bring. A couple of days out from our visit they kindly warned us about the possibility of very poor weather over our weekend (which thankfully didn't eventuate) but this is really a hallmark of how caring and thoughtful they are, both as hosts and as people.
We were driving from DC and after months of COVID stress we needed a peaceful break with our kids. We arrived at Abend Hafen in the late afternoon and the whole place was full of birds (including hummingbirds!!) coming down to the birdbath and feeders in the late afternoon light. Kathy and Rick met us on arrival and showed us around our accommodation, which is adjoins their house but has plenty of privacy. I should mention that the photos on the website do not do justice to how beautifully the small house is set up. Everything is finished to a really high standard, and with so many cosy and personal touches, including freshly baked cookies and fruit loaf, and so many snacks and goodies for breakfast. They have provided lovely, high quality linens and towels, and the fridge was filled with berries, milk, juices etc. No detail has been overlooked, and there is a wonderful bookshelf filled with books about the area, birding guides and information about the Blackwater Reserve (an incredible place, don't miss it!) and their management of the forest around their property. We asked for more information about their forestry management and were very happy to get a mini presentation about it, and we spent quite a bit of time with Rick and Kathy hearing about the area and just chatting, but if what you want is a quiet and uninterrupted getaway, they are also very considerate about giving you your space.
The property itself is amazing, and our son had a wonderful time driving around on Rick's Gator. We thought it so generous that he was willing to let a kid drive it, but this is the lovely people they are -- our kids had the best time just hanging out and chatting, helping feed the chickens and learning about all of the amazing birdlife. Rick showed them how to build a bluebird house that they were able to bring home with them, and they couldn't have been prouder or more excited. We almost thought they were going to cry when they said goodbye to Kathy and Rick!
So much more we could write, but it's most important just to say that Kathy and Rick are two of the loveliest and

This was one of our favorite Airbnb experiences of all time. Kathy and Rick are incredible hosts - they treated us like family! They provided excellent local tips, repeatedly made sure we had absolutely everything we needed to be comfortable, and gave us total free reign to explore their tree farm! We learned a lot about forest conservation and felt like we had rested for a week instead of a day and a half at the end of our stay. We're coming back in September! We could not possibly recommend Kathy and Rick's place enough.

We cannot praise this AirBnB and its hosts enough! They excelled at every segment: outstanding hospitality, exceptional friendliness, and impeccable facilities and amenities. This is a truly unique place, and Kathy and Rick are true Superhosts and just wonderful people whom you won't forget once you met them.
The tree farm is huge, and you feel that you are staying in a real forest full of different plants and animals. You, as a guest, have access to every corner of the farm, and can easily spend a day or two simply exploring the Abend Hafen. Kathy and Rick are great story-tellers, so you won't feel bored from any perspective. Also, Kathy is a savvy baker, who makes unbelievable scones to-die-for.
The part of the house intended for AirBnB guests is large enough for a group of four, and is as clean as a good hospital. The kitchenette is equipped with useful appliances that allow you to make some simple meals or reheat food. Also, a BBQ grill and extra space is available for cooking in netted pavilion nearby. Since we have stayed for 4 days and because we like to cook, we brought a portable butane 1-burner tabletop stove and a multi-cooker with us, and it worked just great for us.
Dorchester County has a lot to offer: we biked, kayaked, visited local winery and brewery, saw some historical sites in nearby Church Creek and Taylor's Island. Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge is a must-see site in the area. There are other interesting places but most of them were temporarily closed due to coronavirus. Still we did not have enough time to visit all places of interest, and plan to come back and stay at Abend Hafen as soon as an opportunity arises.
Remember, Abend Hafen is a gem and Kathy and Rick are Superhosts and wonderful folks worth meeting! :)

This place is truly unique! Kathy and Rick are friendly and welcoming hosts with a wealth of valuable knowledge about the Blackwater Region. The room is cozy and perfect for a couple and property is a working tree farm with trails, a pond, a swing, and photo blind for bird lovers. We loved the many chickens and enjoyed meeting each one. We also enjoyed talking to Rick about the history of the area and its natural wonders. We could not have been happier with our stay.
Amazing Airbnb, super nice space and generous hosts. Kathy and Rick were super friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We hope to be back!

It was such a treat to land at Kathy and Rick's oasis. From the moment I stepped on the property, they treated me with such kindness and generosity. I felt apart of the family instantly and it was really fun sitting and talking with them about the area and life. I found it a very peaceful spot and I was able to really relax. I enjoyed biking from their place over to a secret beach that Kathy told me about and of course wandering around their property. Wonderful place to stay! I was sad to go.

Rick and Kathy are WONDERFUL! We had a lovely time at their place. We had our own private section, with our own entrance. The place was super quiet and cozy. They provided us with fruit, yogurt and baked goods for breakfast. There were tons of snacks available to us too! The place was extra clean and well maintained. THE FARM IS HUGE! we spent an entire day just exploring the farm. We went there during the corona virus outbreak and it felt safe and clean. Rick and Kathy maintained their distance, wore masks and cared about our wellbeing. They they loved telling us about the farm and the wildlife refuge when we asked, and they invited us to have drinks with them which was lovely! If you're not a chatty person like I am, then you'll be left to do your own thing.
Such a nice place, very clean, perfect gateway from the city ! Rick is passionate about nature and a very kind host ! Definetly recommand to friends
This is a beautiful property with acres of beautiful trees and a pond. Lovely place to walk in nature.

Katy and Ricks place is a true gem. Not just the environment but the two of them truly welcome you and make you feel right at home.
I loved the step in tub. It’s one of those that you close the door and then fill the tub. So amazing! At night, I opened the windows and listened to the frogs and cicadas...so soothing.
I’m planning on returning next year and this time, I’ll be saying longer.

Amazing hospitality. Kathie & Rick miss no detail! From the home-made scones, impeccable space and the nature-filled land that they share with their guests! Best airbnb yet! A little piece of heaven!!

Top-notch ratings for hospitality, comfort, and sparkling clean space! Kathy and Rick are wonderful hosts who love to share the beauty of their farm with others, and the thoughtful touches--especially the breakfast and snack supplies--made our stay very enjoyable. Thank you! We'll be back!

This was our second stay with Rick and Kathy who are wonderful hosts. The place is super clean and comfortable. Rick gave us a very informative tour of their beautiful property. We wouldn’t go anywhere else when visiting the area.

Comfort, quiet, and thoughtful touches make this one of the top Airbnbs I've ever stayed in. Can't wait to bring family back for more than a one-night stay. The hike through the property's lob lolly pine acreage with its pond, photo blind and natural beauty is worth the trip alone. Having quick access to Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge and the surrounding area is a definite plus. Rick was most interesting as he shared his knowledge of the area and history of the amazing trees on his property. An A-plus stay for sure!
Rick took excellent care of us with helpful suggestions. Their place is a beautiful, nature infused location which is a welcome change and so close to Blackwater NWR.

Kathy and Rick are Super-hosts, who have warm and cozy guest accommodations that are kept neat and very clean. Their location on the Eastern Shore, near the Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge, offers outdoor activities, eagle sightings and other birds and wildlife. Or you could settle in with a good book, whichever suites you. We would definitely recommend this to friends.
Great spot and hospitality and thoughtfulness was great.
This place is exceptionally clean, and Rick was a fantastic host! The pictures don't do it justice. Nice quiet place very comfortable and all the touches that make a place a home where there.
This place was warm and welcoming. it was just the quiet escape I was looking for the weekend mn,,b g

It was a unique and wonderful experience staying on Rick and Kathy's Tree Farm! Kathy was out of town, but Rick was the consummate host in every serving and engaging way. Our accommodations were spotless; there was various breakfast foods and beverages available; and there was a variety of local information which was in our living quarters and which Rick provided separately. We like to bike and kayak, and the area was not only accommodating but actually "focused" on these outdoor recreational activities.
Rick and Kathy's Tree Farm also was truly a "unique" Airbnb accommodation in that their large farm also provides wide walking paths and many sites for viewing and photographing wildlife......in many settings of woods, marsh and fields. We will definitely return!

We loved our stay at Kathy and Rick's! They are great hosts, so attentive and informative. The accommodations are sparkling clean, comfy, cozy and peaceful. It's a great place to connect with nature, take a walk in the woods and enjoy a bonfire. The kitchen was stocked with yummy breakfast options, healthy snacks and delicious fresh baked scones. AND, the friendly chickens were a bonus!

Rick and Kathy's is the best experience that we have had with an Airbnb. Fresh baked scones, a refrigerator and basketfull of treats, and a tastefully decorated and clean place to enjoy the Eastern Shore. Hospitality is their gift!
So many nice touches. They were awesome with our little boy. We will be back!

What a wonderful place! The hosts are super friendly, the apartment is very clean. There are lots of extras. We especially loved the wooded tree farm.
Rick and Kathy treat you like family and immediately make you feel at home.

Kathy and Rick's place is amazing: A historic tree farm near the Chesapeake Bay. Kathy and Rick provide a personal check in with history of the farm and the home baked scones were wonderful. I would definitely book this treasure again!

Me and my parents were doing a road trip and around Pennsylvania, Virginia and Delaware. We decided to take a stop in Madison and found Rick and Kathy's place. The place is very nice and calm and has everything you need. They are so hospitable! I recommend going to the blackwater visitors center where you can see birds of prey from an observatory, and if you're lucky you get to see a bald eagle.
Beautiful spot, great bird watching, best of all great host
Outstanding, Rick and Kathy were great hosts and the place was very charming and clean. Will definitely go back again. Great for anyone who wants to fish in the area, boat access nearby.

I wish I could give more than 5 stars! What an amazing experience. Beautiful farm, wonderful people, comfortable place. They shared details about the farm ecosystem, I got to see the chickens and the hospitality was second to none! Super clean and well stocked with food. So much to do and see within 20 minutes. Can't wait to go back. Thank you both for taking such good care of Lola and me!!!

This place is a gem. Kathy and Rick are focused on building a true experience with their stay. I was given privacy within the separate apartment while encouraged to explore the property, join the couple for breakfast, and receive a tour. They let me use their atv (the gator), lent me boots and toiletries, offered to get me food from the store, and provided me a local history lesson to help me with my book. As a solo traveler, this was the perfect place - quiet, private, but conveniently located - to work on a solo project.
This b&b would be great for families, couples, or friends, but it’s also a great place to escape to, alone, and enjoy a quiet weekend in the countryside with big skies, big trees, bird watching, and relaxing. And if you ever get lonely, Kathy and Rick are right there to chat, recommend local spots, or share a cup of coffee. The property is lovely, but the hosts are what make it truly shine. I left feeling like a friend.
Everything was perfect. We loved spending time with the hosts. They have great Tipps on where to go. Hopefully we can stay longer the next time.

Such a lovely place to visit. Rick and Kathy have added many thoughtful touches that make this airbnb extra special. We really liked having a living room, kitchen, and even breakfast! Clean and comfortable. And, right in the middle of a tree farm!

We had a fantastic time at Rick’s and Cathy’s. It is a true refuge near the real thing (ie Blackwater). Cathy had made us scones, and Rick was incredibly generous with his time and impressive fount of knowledge about the local wildlife. The ´apartment’ was like a deluxe safari experience- wonderful sleeping and great amenities in a beautiful, natural setting. A five-star experience.

Outstanding! Kathy & Rick are the most hospitable hosts. They accomdated us on a same day request. They have created a beautiful space for their guests, that has both a sense of love and pride. We enjoyed our time on their beautiful property and hope to visit again.

Kathy and Rick were absolutely the best hosts you could wish for. They were kind, thoughtful, and affectionate. My family had a blast at their farm. Also, the wildlife we observed on the farm was fascinating. Would definitely recommend and visit their place again. Thanks once again to Kathy and Rick :)

Kathy and Rick are outstanding hosts with a lovely property. The room space is very comfortable and larger than expected. Breakfast included a large quantity of fresh, delicious berries along with yogurt, muffins, oatmeal, cereal and assorted drinks. Would stay again!

Kathy and Rick are friendly, warm, generous hosts! I was in Cambridge with a friend to hang my art show at the Dorchester Center For The Arts, and it was a perfect, immaculately clean place to take a break after a long day of hard work. The homemade scones were a delicious surprise.....If only I could rent by the month!

This was the best AirB&B stay we've ever had! Kathy and Rick are outstanding hosts. Their place is immaculate, and the extra special touches, especially the fresh baked goods, are wonderful. Kathy accommodated our special dietary needs (vegan & nut-free) in providing both breakfast supplies and delicious baked treats, and she even agreed to custom make a birthday cake for our daughter (separate payment, since this was additional to our stay). Rick and Kathy are excellent conversationalists and provided great information and tips about the local area. They even lent us a cooler, beach chairs and a quilt when we went to Assateague State Park for the day. We also greatly enjoyed the guided tour of their tree farm. Their place is quiet and offers excellent bird watching directly from the unit, as the double sliders open out to the bird bath and feeder area. They are convenient for cycling, kayaking, exploring the Blackwater Nature Reserve, historic Cambridge, and getting out to the beach. In addition, the farm itself offers walking trails and a pond for wildlife-viewing, fishing or just sitting in the swing and reflecting. If you're looking for a place to relax and take a break from the stress of work and city living, this is the perfect spot with great hosts. We will be back regularly.
Such a great stay!!

Kathy & Rick- thanks for going above and beyond with our 2 college students. They were both very pleased with the hospitality that Rick showed them. They even said they signed your “guest book” . As host you both went above and beyond to make their stay memorable!
Perfect spot to relax and appreciate nature, great bird watching spot

Kathy and Rick have a generous nature and love for the world around them. They provided wonderful breakfast selections. Their little piece of this earth is brimming with nature. It is a gift to be able to share it with them.

Our stay was absolutely fantastic. Rick and Kathy welcomed us with open arms and a cozy space. Everything was clean, and they even stocked the fridge and pantry with snacks, drinks, and breakfast items.
We were in town for the Eagleman Ironman Competition which made for very early mornings. Kathy was quick to respond and even offer help at any hour of the day, including providing chairs for us to take to the event at 4am! They also provided us with umbrellas, a cooler, beach blankets and extra towels for our excursion. Kathy baked us chocolate chip cookies which our kids devoured, and Rick took us on a tour of their extensive property. I cannot say enough nice things about them, or our experience. We highly recommend booking with these lovely people!

This place is definitely a farmstay, off the beaten Cambridge path (though right on the Harriet Tubman byway). Plenty of space and super friendly hosts---in addition to fresh baked goods, we got a tour of their lumber farm and even an annotated map of Blackwater Refuge with highlighter marks for every bird nest with chicks. A wonderful place for anyone who wants a good perspective on the Eastern Shore in a nice location.

Being in Kathy and Rick’s home was such a blessing. They have the most beautiful Airbnb and they are the most hospitable, loving and joyful people ever! We highly recommend this place. It is incredibly clean, peaceful and comfortable. Kathy and Rick go out of their way or make you feel welcome and comfortable. We appreciate them so much!

Discovering Madison Nature Getaway was like winning the lottery - spacious, spotless accommodations in a beautiful setting with abundant wildlife, and thoughtfully stocked with an assortment of breakfast items. Not just coffee and tea, but fresh fruit, muffins, juice, yogurt, hot & cold cereals; Kathy and Rick go above and beyond the usual expectations to assure a comfortable stay. And they were generous with their time, sharing information about the farm, the local wildlife, and background about the points of interest. Don't miss Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge or the Harriet Tubman Museum!
And for a really fun time, share a table at Palm Beach Willies with Rick and Kathy and enjoy some great conversation; they've led interesting lives and are delightful dinner companions.
We'll be returning next year, looking forward to more of Rick & Kathy's hospitality and hoping we'll be lucky enough to again be there when Kathy's baking peach cobbler :)

An utterly charming spot, especially for birders and other nature-lovers. The unit was well-equipped, with a completely stocked larder. Rick and Kathy are the sort of hosts you dream about -- friendly, informative and respectful.

This location is a wildlife wonderland. Nature is bountiful in many forms: frogs, turtles, woodland ducks, screech owls, and many birds along with their babies; it's a hidden paradise. The accommodations are excellent. The space is quite large with a living room, dining room, kitchen, large bedroom, and a full bath. The queen size bed was so comfortable I felt like I was sleeping in my own bed. The space is spotless and meets every need from extra towels to a fully equipped kitchen. There are snacks and fresh fruit to squash any hunger, and a full-size coffee pot, which my husband was so excited to see. Lastly and certainly not least are the hosts Rick and Kathy. They are warm and welcoming and very accommodating. We ran very late (work and then traffic) and yet we arrived to find Kathy and Rick smiling and waving, happily greeting us. The getaway is peaceful and relaxing yet conveniently located near Blackwater Refuge (an amazing bald eagle experience).
Image sitting in a rocking chair on the deck, watching the birds play in the baths while being serenaded by frogs….a great way to end any day.

Kathy and Rick were the most kind, generous and thoughtful air bnb host I have ever met. If you’re heading down the eastern shore in their general direction, they’ve got you covered. The place is great, comfortable, and charming, and their local knowledge, resources and commitment to the environment is impressive. Five-star folks and a five-star air bnb experience!

Incredible hosts, in an amazing place. I woke up with a cold my second day there, and Kathy showed up with DayQuil and Tylenol Cold & Flu within minutes of hearing of my plight. The rooms were pristine, towels better than Hyatt, the best coffee I've ever had. If you're looking for peace, quiet and relaxation, this is the spot. Their passion about the area and especially the Blackwater Reserve is inspiring and their recommendations were great.
A nature-lovers paradise!

This is such a hidden gem! It doesn’t appear to be much as you turn off the road, but to the grounds are simply amazing, and Rick is so knowledgeable about the forestry, the ecosystem, and the surrounding areas, including the wildlife refuge. Kathy was away, but Rick was generous with his time… Taking us fishing, showing us the property, and making sure we had whatever we needed. I was traveling with kids, and he included some pop tarts in our selection of snacks! Actually, the selection of food and drinks was quite generous :) The living space was immaculate, very comfortable, and clearly shows the hosts have put a lot of thought into their home. I was simply cruising the Eastern shore for some fishing spots with my boys and am so glad to have stayed here. I would highly recommend this for anyone with an interest in ecological tourism, especially given how close it is to the refuge, lots of local waterways, and other outdoor spaces.

Cozy, quiet, clean sanctuary. Very peaceful and nice touches, such as breakfast food and snacks and wine. Kathy was away, but Jim did an amazing hosting job, showing us around and making sure we had everything we needed. Would definitely return.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Madison Nature Getaway! The hospitality was wonderful! Rick took us on a tour around the farm on his Gator which was an unexpected treat! He took us to the photo blind at the pond where we watched all the beautiful wood ducks fly in. My husband and daughter later tested their skills fishing at the pond where they caught bass and sunfish. Our family of 3 only stayed one night but we could have easily stayed longer. The space was very comfortable and nicely decorated. Kathy and Rick thought of everything and more, from the cute books all around to the games to the well stocked continental breakfast which was way more than we expected. We would without a doubt do it all over again!
Rick is very knowledgeable and a great lover of wildlife. The b&b was spotless....highly recommended. Very thoughtful and kind hosts...every need taken care of in advance!!

Aben Hafen farm is a lovely get-away that is the perfect blend of remote yet close to some of Dorchester County's best tourist destinations: Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge, the Harriett Tubman Underground Railroad Park and Visitor's Center, and the cute town of Cambridge. Plus, it's smack dab in the middle of the Harriett Tubman Underground Railroad Byway, a driving tour that can be downloaded and provides a moving audio history. The space itself is cozy and was perfect for our family of four. It was clean as a whistle, the beds were comfortable, and there were plenty of pillows. And the farm provides a perfect backdrop, with beautiful walks through the woods and to a picturesque pond that comes alive in late winter with wood ducks (and hosts other water birds--such as great blue heron--the rest of the year). Kathy and Rick could not have been nicer or more gracious hosts who can provide keen insights about local life and opportunities. We highly recommend this to others who want to enjoy the slower pace and pastoral beauty of Maryland's Eastern Shore. I'm certain we'll return!
The ultimate Chesapeake experience with folks who love life!

We so much enjoyed our stay with Kathy and Rick. They are so very welcoming and interesting. The place is perfect and we especially enjoyed the wood fire on a cold and soggy night! We hope to see them again. We highly recommend this place to everyone!
Quiet, peaceful. Off the beaten path. Clean and comfortable
Loved our stay at Kathy and Rick’s farm. Great location and wonderful hosts. We’ll be back!
The Oyster House was beautiful and tranquil. It was perfect for our family and made our short but fun packed stay totally worth it.
The location and the guest house were really great - very happy with our stay!
very nice stay! beautifully refurbished house and great location/easy access. Kristen was very responsive and even arranged pick-up of forgotten items after we left. 10/10 would stay again!
Place was great! Quiet and clean, perfect for our family weekend.

Brandon’s home was perfect for my stay. I slept great too. The house was clean and so nice and new. Brandon has been super responsive since I made my reservation. I would definitely recommend this lovely home in Cambridge

We were visiting our Airman at McGuire AFB for the week of Thanksgiving. We decided to drive to Washington, DC to spend Thanksgiving and found this home. It is very cute and clean. We probably should have stayed in a place closer to Washington, DC, which was about an hour and a half drive and then a 3 hour trip back to McGuire AFB. We did have a great Thanksgiving. This home was very spacious, it was clean and uncluttered and provided a nice stay for our weekend.

This is a nicely equipped, new condo. The welcome basket was a nice touch. Everything you need is provided. We enjoyed our stay, but found the booking process a little strange. He also did not disclose an extra contract we needed to sign prior to coming until it was too late to back out. This contract and any of his restrictions should be on the listing. The area is fun to explore and the complex feels safe.

Brandon’s place was beautiful and perfect for a family vacation! The house was spotless and extremely comfortable, and the views and surroundings did not disappoint. Our family especially loved the community pool and seafood restaurants. Brandon was really helpful and available. Would definitely recommend!

Brandon’s airbnb was an incredible find. Perfect for families and our small little ones all under 6 years old to a newborn. Exactly pictured as described and walkable to many amenities. Incredibly clean and quiet. Spacious and relaxing. Modern and bright. Perfection. Host was so nice and communicative (left us a goodie welcome box) and it felt like a home away from home. We will be back!

This place was great - exactly what we wanted. Nice, clean, and big. Extremely well decorated and homey. Pool in neighborhood was perfect. Very easy to walk into town. The code for door didn't work when we arrived but Brandon was easy to reach and fixed it right away. Highly recommend.

Brandon's home was just perfect for my family! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Cambridge and look forward to visiting again! The home was immaculate and had everything we needed for a relaxing, stress-free trip-comfy beds, cozy throw blankets, lots of living space, plenty of smart TV's and a very thoughtful welcome basket! My kids and I loved having the bikes available to take to the pool or to town. The marina across the street is a great place to walk and relax during the evening hours. I would highly recommend this property to anyone wanting to visit the Cambridge area!

Brandon’s place is spotless, everything is new and clean. The unit is well stocked with bed linens, towels, toilet paper, pool/beach towels, basically everything you need. Brandon was friendly and easy to communicate with. There are a few cute restaurants within walking distance. We also used bikes that are available at the unit and went paddle boarding in near by St. Michaels. All around great experience. Thank you Brandon!

Our stay was phenomenal. Everything was great and we enjoyed the area. The house was clean, organized, and even smelled good. Every expectation going into this house was exceeded. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a quiet spot with ample amounts of things to do.

Brandon and Melissa’s home was beautiful, clean, modern and well-appointed! Nice views of the water and sailboats, and a lovely community, walkable to the downtown. The townhome had everything we needed for a long weekend, and more!
I highly recommend their home and look forward to return in the future!

My family has been coming to the eastern shore every summer for many years, and this is by far the best airbnb we have ever stayed in! Great amenities, easy check-in, and amazingly clean. Our little one (3.5) felt right at home, and mom and dad could relax right away. From the evening walks around the marina to cooking in the fabulous kitchen, we made so many memories. I (mom) also had to work remotely for the week, and the downstairs living room was a great, quiet, and bright remote office :-). Brandon’s instructions were so thorough and clear - everything was a breeze. We look forward to coming back soon!

enjoyed our three day stay with Brandon. photos matched the place, good location, nice pool access. host responsive and provided local recommendations. left a really nice welcome note/treats on our arrival

What an amazing getaway place! It is in a great location, close to many shops and restaurants and a short drive from other scenic attractions. It is ideal for bird and wildlife enthusiasts, as well as those who enjoy nature! Brandon’s place had everything you could think of! Beautiful, comfortable, and fully furnished apartment with free parking, stunning views, and has everything you actually need to prepare a meal. Brandon was a great host who gave us many great recommendations for spots to check out! We will most certainly return to enjoy this little piece of heaven and would highly recommend this AirBnb to anyone!

Enjoyed a weekend stay for a nearby conference. The house is a lovely as pictured. Brandon was a great host providing clear check-in and check-out instructions. Would definitely recommend or stay again.

My family had never been to the Eastern shore but a friend recommended Cambridge. What a hidden gem of a town, and Brandon was a great host. Very responsive and helpful with suggestions of what to do in the area. The townhouse is well equipped with all the creature comforts, all kinds of coffee, fully stocked kitchen, and REALLY comfortable beds. Seriously like better than a nice hotel. The house has a great layout for two families, although it was just us and my mother-in-law. We used the bikes a lot. I wished we could have taken advantage of the kayaks but it was a little too cold. We loved Phippins Craft Center for the kids and Blue Ruin for the grown-ups--delicious food, craft cocktails and trivia. High Spot was delicious with vegan options and beer from the local brewery. The highlight was Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge but the Harriet Tubman museum was also great and very interactive for the kids. We did a day trip to St. Michaels as well. Would definitely stay here again.

My family visited Cambridge for Spring Break and had a wonderful time. Brandon’s place was spotless, it was very comfortable, clean and peaceful, with all the amenities provided. The location was great, we were able to walk into town for dinner and spent a day at the Hyatt hotel swimming pool which was a short drive down the road. The pool on-site was not open for the season yet. We were very lucky with the weather. All in all a great time spent at Brandon’s home.

We had a great stay! The house was beautiful, spotlessly clean, and had every amenity we could have needed. The wi-fi was strong enough for us to both work with ease when we needed to, and the TV and comfortable couch in the living room was a great way to relax and unwind at night. It has a garage which is very convenient to use when entering/exiting the house. We'll certainly stay here again the next time we're in Cambridge! It was a wonderful experience and I recommend this house very highly!

This vacation home is truly perfect! Our family stayed here for a week and we just didn't want to leave! This is the first time the whole family has traveled together since the pandemic, and we could not have asked for a better setting, more enjoyable trip, or a more accommodating host. The house is in a great location, with views of the water from inside, and the sunset views are stunning. The home has all the amenities one could possibly need while on vacation and is tastefully and cozily furnished. We prepared most of our meals in the spacious and well-equipped kitchen. We had a great time visiting the Harriet Tubman Museum and the Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge. I'm looking forward to returning to this house. Brandon had been a wonderful host before, during, and after our trip! THANK YOU FOR THIS AMAZING EXPERIENCE!

Our family spent a wonderful long weekend here, and it was without a doubt one of our favorite vacations. The house was exactly as described, and there were plenty of activities for our children to keep them entertained while we were there. Crabbing, fishing, kayaking, and exploring the historic downtown were among our favorite activities. Brandon was very communicative and accommodating. He even left us a welcome gift when we arrived. I would highly recommend this Airbnb to anyone, and hope to return someday soon!

This home is beautifully furnished and designed with thoughtful touches throughout. Our dog appreciated the yard and we appreciated the beautiful bedding, the air conditioning, and comfort of the living room and screened patio. The location allowed for easy parking and lots of exploring. We were very pleased with our stay.

What a beautiful house! When we got home, it smelled very good, everything was spotless!!1
Communication with the host is easy and fast. The neighborhood is also nice!
Give me a perfect note!
Bring coffee, there's a coffee maker. We bought food but not coffee. I love a cup first thing in the morning; instead of buying coffee for the house, we walked to Black Waters coffee shop.
Family of 4 coming kin to visit relatives. Great place!!

We were welcomed with a personalized sign and a basket of treats, nice personalized touch.
The pictures were an accurate depiction of the property.
Would have been more convenient/ efficient for our group if the second bathroom had a shower instead of a free standing tub.
Would return without reservation.

We had a lovely stay here and would happily return in the future. The house was spotless, comfortable, and well-equipped (including the kitchen). The wifi worked well enough to support two of us working remotely. The beds and bedding were great. Our dog appreciated the fenced-in yard and the two parks that were short walks away. The house was a 10-minute walk from some Cambridge favorites, including RAR Brewing. Adina was a very responsive host, and she provided some excellent recommendations! So did the neighbor (Boats and Hose is not to be missed - the best crab cakes we have ever had). Highly recommend a stay here and using Cambridge as a jumping off point to explore all the Eastern Shore has to offer.
Lovely home, responsive hosts, clean, comfortable, and quiet. Easy walking distance to downtown. Highly recommend!

I think they need to add 6 Stars, because this was truly a 6 Star accommodation. Such a lovely place, and everything looked as pictured if not better. My family had a wonderful time and the only bad thing was us having to leave. I know I will be back in Cambridge in the future to see family in the area and this is the only place I plan on staying at from now on. Thank you again to our host.

Great Home!
Excellent, Beautiful, Spacious and Super Clean !
Will definitely come back !

I booked this incredible home for my first Ironman due to its proximity to start and finish lines and I was blown away by my experience. We felt right at home. Everything we needed was at our fingertips and the place was spotless. Great decor and plenty my of space for my family to relax before the big race. The best part about this home is the location. I was able to walk everywhere including downtown to bars and restaurants. If you’re participating in Ironman and or Eaglemam, this spot is perfect. .43 miles to finish line. .6 miles to start.
I would highly recommend this beautiful and spotless home for your next trip to Cambridge. I really lucked out. Thank you Adina!

This cozy Cambridge home is very quaint, clean, and nicely appointed! The remodeled kitchen is just gorgeous and so easy to cook in. Adina had all the helpful things on hand we tend to forget (foil, spices, condiments, dishwasher solution etc.) and the cabinets had more than enough cooking supplies to help us feel at home. There is even a dining room and table with a bar cart--which was perfect for making cocktails. The living room furniture is a comfy spot to sit as a family and watch a movie. The beds were very comfortable and we were so impressed by the little touches from Adina and Bobby like the welcome basket, bath salts for the tub, and sunflowers when we arrived. We loved being walking distance from downtown Cambridge -- you gotta stop into RaR brewery and Ava's pizza -- and easily accessible to walks on the waterfront. St. Michaels is about a 35 min drive and super easy day trip. We'll be back!

I loved my stay at Adina and Bobby’s. The neighborhood is fantastic. One block to the water. Short walk to the marina. Bunny rabbits in the backyard. Just peace and quiet for days. I lived on the screened-in back porch. It’s the perfect place for everything. Did morning yoga there. Plugged in my laptop and did work and took meetings. Ate meals. Sipped wine.
The house was spotless and had every amenity you need. If you want to cook, the kitchen is fully-equipped. There was a lovely welcome basket of snacks and wine. The beds are really comfortable, and you’ll sleep well in the quiet neighborhood.
I’ll definitely be returning again and again.

Adina’s Cambridge Cottage was a picturesque stay in a nice quaint neighborhood on the Chesapeake Bay! The home was warm and inviting, and I truly enjoyed the complimentary amenities that were provided. I would 10/10 recommend!

We stayed at Adina's place while attending at wedding at the Cambridge Hyatt. We had 3 adults, 1 toddler, and 2 dogs - the place was perfect for us! First, there are 2 full baths and 3 bedrooms with ample space and beds. Second, there was an enclosed yard and enclosed back deck, both for the dogs, baby, and accompanying guardians to enjoy. Third, it was just blocks from the water - the main attraction for us. Finally, the house had so many small Eastern Shore touches that we sincerely enjoyed - from the artwork to the welcome basket with Rise Coffee and St Michaels wines. We would highly recommend and would stay again.

I’ve stayed in Airbnb’s before but this is my absolute favorite!!! It was peaceful, clean and charming. We saw bunny rabbits every morning, had coffee and listened to music on the enclosed porch, sat in the back yard to sun bathe, took long baths in the claw foot tub and we even ventured out to visit the Harriet Tubman museum . This is a home you don’t want to leave for the weekend. The beds were incredible. The house had absolutely everything you’d ever need. My friends and I had a blast . It’s less than 10 mins. from the Main Street in Cambridge and within 10 minutes of your shopping needs. The host are professional and thoughtful! ( they left a goodie basket on the kitchen counter filled with goodies i.e. local wine, specialty coffee, energy bars and more because they knew we were celebrating a birthday! ) This is my 2nd time staying here and the only place I plan to stay when I return. Honestly I didn’t want to leave but I can say I felt rejuvenated! Thank U for having Us!

Best Airbnb I’ve stayed at in a while and it’s been years since I’ve stayed somewhere. 10/10 would recommend! You will not regret booking here, feels like a home away from home. Hosts were great and responsive, what more could you ask for! Can’t wait to stay again in the future. Thanks for bringing hospitality back. Thanks for going above and beyond!

The home was pleasantly decorated and comfortable. The owners thought of everything you would need for a home away from home. Plenty of dishes, utensils and cookware. They even provided hand soap and paper products along with a welcome basket! The neighborhood is quiet with friendly neighbors and close to downtown restaurants and shops. It’s also bike friendly. Private fenced backyard was enjoyed by our dogs and the screened porch was great. Only problem was how steep the stairs were and how low the ceiling was in the stairwell. I’m only 5 ft and my head was close to the top of the stairs. This is typical for houses this age but something to be aware of if you’re tall or have trouble navigating stairs. Another note the secondary bedrooms utilize a pass through which wasn’t a problem for our stay as we only needed one of them. However you could get around that by locking the door to the bathroom and the pass through bedroom for privacy. I will recommend this home to friends and family

We had an incredible stay for an Eastern Shore long weekend. The house was close to town, near the water and several parks, and a great jumping off point for exploring further afield. Everything inside was modern and comfortable, and we appreciated nice touches from the owners like a welcome basket and bathroom equipment for our toddler. We will be back!

As advertised. Very comfortable home for us and our dogs. We brought our own sheets to cover the couch. Walked to dinner one night. Fenced in back yard was great for the dogs. Lovely home and we felt comfortable and very welcomed as soon as we stepped inside!

This was a perfect Eastern shore getaway! Adina and Bobby were wonderful hosts and their house had all the amenities and comforts of home with beautiful decor. I would highly recommend and look forward to going back!

This was a great find! Super close to parks and water, we were there for an Ironman race and couldn't have gotten a better place! We walked to race check in, in the am. Lots of extras in kitchen and bathrooms. Beds are comfy, furniture is beautiful and comfy. There is a back porch screened in! We' ll most likely be back.

Wow, wow,wow! A beautiful well furnished home with touches of old and modern smartly combined. The home came well equipped with items that are easily forgotten right down to all kinds of kitchen utensils and serving dishes. Kudos to a job well done! Adina’s instructions on departure times were insightful and very helpful. Do follow them! I totally enjoyed the quietness at night and the easy going days walking the neighborhood to the marina and downtown to restaurants and shops. My dog enjoyed the big yard immensely along with the walks to the marina park. Definitely coming back soon! Already my friends are making plans to book the property. You won’t regret it at all!
Thanks Adina and Bobby for making my birthday weekend a great one! Evelyn

We enjoyed a wonderful girls’ weekend at this beautiful house. It’s the perfect jumping off point to explore all the towns of the Eastern Shore, and it’s in east walking distance of local spots in Cambridge.
It’s spacious and comfortable for cooking and hanging out. We especially loved making meals in the big open kitchen & aperitifs on the screened in porch. Adina was a responsive and helpful host. Hope to stay here again!
Gorgeous house so cozy! we had a great time

Adina & Bobbie, our stay was such a wonderful experience. You have a lovely home. It was so cozy, which made me want to a stay a few more days. This is my hometown and it was so good to come home. Everything was so well decorated . We enjoyed the back porch and of course we grilled! The kitchen was amazing. I cooked every day. I couldn't stay out of the claw tub in the bathroom.
The beds were the most comfortable I've had the pleasure to sleep in. Anything that you desired was there for your convenience . I will be back to this wonderful home soon. Thanks Adina & Boobie. You are two great hosts.
Absolutely adorable cottage and incredible hosts.

We had a wonderful 2 week stay at Adina's. We got to play with our 18 month granddaughter while her parents teleworked. The house was perfectly suited for all of us and our various activities. Everything was shipshape and we were particularly amazed by the well-equipped kitchen and the screened back porch.
The house is conveniently located: close to the water, walking distance from a park with playground and a small beach which our granddaughter very much enjoyed and to great restaurants in downtown Cambridge. The neighborhood is very quiet and the neighbors were very nice. We got to visit Oxford and St Michael's which are nearby.
To top it all, we had the best welcome basket and note of any AirBnB we ever rented. Thanks Adina!
Awesome kitchen! Nice and cozy home!

This house was absolutely perfect for our recent visit to Cambridge. We were in town for a wedding and Lia's home was an ideal home base for our family of four, as we had a number of different events to attend in the area. Not only was the location perfect for our travel but there was the added bonus of being in town during the Cambridge Classic Power Boat Regatta, which we got to enjoy watching right from the comfort of the beautiful dining room and backyard. The home is filled with lovely touches that made our stay absolutely delightful and the Choptank river views are so serene and peaceful. Lia was the perfect host and I highly recommend this great property to anyone looking to visit the Cambridge area. We would absolutely return if our travels bring us back this way!
This was a beautiful and peaceful setting. The home was very clean and well appointed. Everything you need was included and more. Lia was the ultimate host. Our family really enjoyed our stay.

This place is unbelievable. The photos look beautiful but being there, you realize they don't do it justice. Besides the beauty of the surroundings and the fact that you're essentially in a cul de sac so there's no traffic (excellent for when travelling with kids and if you want peace and quiet), this house is the best equipped house/property we've ever stayed at anywhere in the world. Think of anything you'd have at home to prepare a meal, toys for the kids, entertainment, outside hanging out, and they have it and more. It feels rather like someone is lending you their own well equipped house to stay in. There are many beautiful trees on the property that make for a paintable landscape. The feng shui of the house is amazing. The rooms are well isolated from the noise of the main living spaces. The patio and outside space is absolutely enjoyable. We had to check out by 11 and we made sure to stay until the last minute. Thank you for our amazing Stay Lia and Jeremy!

This home is in a beautiful setting and had everything we needed. Lots of places to sit outside and enjoy the view. The backyard was peaceful at all times of the day. Very tidy and well maintained house. We loved our stay!

A small group of friends and I stayed here for a long weekend and felt like we lucked out on the best AirBnB in the area. The indoor space was clean and had plenty of seating/space for hanging out and playing board games. But the outdoor space was the star of the weekend - there’s great seating looking out on the water, a grill and a solo stove, plenty of space for lawn games and a stunning and peaceful view. Lia was a very responsive host who answered my questions ahead of time to ensure we’d have everything we needed. This was the most well-stocked AirBnB I’ve ever stayed in and the check-in and check-out processes were super simple. Ultimately, this AirBnB was AMAZING and I hope to come back again.
We loved staying here for a friend’s birthday weekend! The home was absolutely stunning and comfortable for our group.
Loved this house
We had a raucous time with three kids 10, 7, and 5. They loved the house! Highlights for them were getting badges from the Harriet Tubman center and National Wildlife refuge.

Highly recommend a stay here. The house is perfect, in a beautiful, peaceful location, with great views. It’s an easy drive or little walk into town, it’s large and roomy, very clean and organised. And Lia is very responsive. Very nice all around!

AWESOME! Lia's place is so beautiful, peaceful, comfortable, and well-equipped! We were also amazed at how clean it is. It feels like a brand new house and is filled with quality furnishings and materials. The rooms are spacious and there are so many nice places to sit and relax or enjoy a meal.
The beds are super comfortable and we had extra blankets and pillows. The bathrooms are spotless and beautifully tiled and we had extra towels. There are clear instructions to use all the appliances and TVs. Check-in and check-out are easy and quick. The back deck is perfect for relaxing and bird watching. When we arrived we saw an eagle catch a fish in the pond and fly off!
The roads are quiet and nice to run, walk or bike on (provided bikes are in great shape!).
The house is just a few minutes from downtown Cambridge and all the great restaurants and shops, and close to everything on the shore.
Lia really went above and beyond to make our stay perfect. We hope to return often!
Our second visit to this delightful home by the water. Highly recommend!

Beautiful home in a wonderful location! You can see in the details of this home that Lia wanted things done right. They are. The home is lovely and very functional. She's thought of everything! From the fixtures in the bathrooms to the comfortable beds, to the two zone HVAC system, and the parts and pieces in the kitchen, all the way down to the s'mores kit: Lia has created a wonderful and inviting space for folks to use to relax!
We only stayed for the weekend. Now that we know about this place, we'll be back.
Our purpose for visiting? Seeing the winter migrating birds at Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge. Blackwater is only ~ 20 minutes away and is an amazing place for seeing and being in nature. If you are into nature/birding and looking for a great place to stay, Lia's place is a terrific option. In fact, you will likely be able to see the bald eagle in the top of the tree by the Choptank river each morning you're there! Lia was lovely to deal with and very responsive.
This is a perfect airbnb! So perfect that we might ask to buy the place ourselves :)
Another great stay at our favorite home in Cambridge! We were so impressed with the space and amenities that we had to return this year. Thanks again Lia for making us feel right at home.
Wonderful spot! Terrific setting. Home updated and comfortable. As well equiped as could be hoped. Responsive host. Five star plus.

We loved the space
It fit the need for my family to celebrate out granddaughters first trip to the eastern shore.
The location is awesome and the host was extremely responsive.
We will stay at this house again

Lia’s place is absolutely beautiful, as are the immediate surroundings. The house is right on a small lake, with the bay within sight. It is newly renovated throughout, nicely furnished and very well stocked with everything you will need for an exceptional holiday. The neighborhood is very quiet and only about a mile from the center of Cambridge. There is a really good coffee shop/bakery in town and several good restaurants. St. Michaels is a half-hour drive, and it is well worth the drive.
Lia is a responsive host. She contacted us ahead of our stay with a range of suggestions of things to do and see in the area. She was quick to respond to any question and always helpful. I highly recommend the house and the host!

Lia’s home was AMAZING! I could not say enough good things about it! They thought of everything and you do not need to bring anything except your clothing. They have it all! It is like being in a hotel (towels, linens, soap, shampoo, hair dryers, ironing boards, toilet paper, fans, pack and play, alarm clocks). The home was exactly as pictured and everything was literally sparkling clean. They made it very family friendly with games and toys for the kids and even child friendly plates, cups, and utensils. The home is surrounded by the most beautiful views and quick drive away from town. Lia is very informative and responsive! My family and I can’t wait to go back! My favorite Airbnb I have ever been to!
