I booked Lia's place for a girls weekend getaway for my birthday. It was absolutely beautiful and so peaceful. The house is right on the water and there are adorable ducks around the area. The house was perfect and Lia is an amazing host. Always so responsive and gave great recommendations. :)
The town is also beautiful and Lia's guidebook was very helpful. Definitely recommend Ava's pizza and Blackwater bakery! They were delicious. I will definitely be back for another visit.

Lia’s place exceeded expectations. It was super clean and well equipped. A really nice touch was the presence of labels on light switches and various pieces of equipment. And full instructions for all the equipment. The ducks and geese were a little unnerving but very cute. It was a perfect place for a relaxing stay.
Had a wonderful time at Lias place! Great Airbnb. Would definitely stay again!
Such a beautiful home!! We could not say enough good things about this house and the hosts!

Lia’s place was absolutely beautiful! The whole house was recently updated. Wonderful fresh new linens, comfortable beds, plates, cups silverware all new. The house is so much bigger than we thought. We loved sitting at the extra large kitchen table and outside on the deck over looking the water. The ducks kept us entertained, little cuties! We enjoyed swinging in the tree swings too! It was the most perfect place for a cousins girl weekend! We took a drive to St. Michaels on Saturday but the rest of the long weekend was spent creating great family memories in this beautiful house! Lia was very responsive and checked to make sure we had everything we needed. It felt like home! Thank you Lia!
Beautiful immaculate home. They thought of EVERYTHING to make your stay comfortable. All details of the listing are accurate and Lia checked in to make sure everything was OK. 5 star all the way.

Beautiful home and description totally accurate
A real home from home we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves
A great base to visit other areas like Oxford, St Michael’s and Black Water Wildlife Refuge
If you like birding it’s a great area
We watched a Bald Head Eagle hunting and catching a turtle and a snake swim across a pond
Great pizza in Ava’s in town
All in all a great experience
Lia has done a fabulous job 👍

This place is incredible. The house shows that the hosts pay attention to make for a beautifully appointed place. The property is located next to a pond and also offers a beautiful view of the river. There is room for a family or group of friends to relax and enjoy the allure of Cambridge and the Eastern Shore. The kitchen offers all amenities to cook up a great meal, but if you’d rather relax on the deck or in the screened gazebo and order in, there are great restaurants nearby. We had a memorable visit and plan to return.

Lia and Jeremy’s place was absolutely beautiful and serene. There were solid, delicious local choices for food nearby (excellent recommendations- thank you!) the scenery was unmatched, and the house and its amenities were perfect. We had everything we needed during our stay and then some. Our kids enjoyed the hammocks and the use of the guitar especially! Thank you Lia and Jeremy for a truly memorable stay!
What an amazing place- clean, comfortable, had absolutely everything you can think of, spacious and modern- it was great for our family and it will be amazing for yours!
Amazing house with such beautiful scenery. Great and lot of amenities. Perfect for a quiet and peaceful getaway.

Beautiful home with positive vibes made us feel right at home. Large common areas was perfect for family time. Have plenty of memories captured in the beautiful backdrop of lake/harbor! Lia’s responsiveness was greatly appreciated!

The pictures do not quite do it justice—Lia’s place has a beautiful unimpeded view of the Choptank. Unusual lot characteristics (backing up onto a pond that flows into the river) make this possible. The setting also makes for great bird watching. There is a screened in gazebo attached to a huge deck overlooking the water. Very private and close to downtown Cambridge. Great place and hosts.

One of the best places we have ever stayed! 5 star!! Lia and Jeremy went above and beyond as hosts. They thought of every details and provided us with everything we need for a relaxing and fun family getaway. We even got to enjoy the 4th of July firework show from town of Cambridge from the comfort of the deck! We can’t wait to come back soon!

Hands down - this is one of the best Airbnb homes we have ever stayed in (and we have stayed in many both in the US and in Europe). The home itself is beautiful - inside and outside. The accommodations - beds, linens, towels, kitchen supplies, furniture - were all beyond what you normally find in a short term rental. And the setting is simply amazing. We loved watching the geese and ducks in the pond and the sailboats on the river. It was so totally relaxing to stay at Lia's home! And Lia is a super host - so easy to communicate with and super responsive. I sincerely wish we have another opportunity to visit the Eastern Shore just so that we can stay in Lia's home again.

Lia’s home was the perfect retreat for our group! Extremely well appointed, every amenity you could need, clean, and well labeled. The views of the pond and bay were beautiful and there was plenty of space for us to spread out and relax. She was very proactive in her communication about the house and went the extra step to make sure we were accommodated. I would highly recommend this home and host. Thanks again Lia!

Lia and Jeremy's house is beautiful, very new, spotless, scenic and very well equipped. We very much enjoyed the water views and found the home to be a comfortable, relaxing and peaceful retreat. It's an easy car ride into the main part of town, and to the the grocery and fish market. Lia is very lovely, responsive and helpful. We will want to return as often as we can!
We had a great weekend at this stunning home! Well-appointed and comfortable in a beautiful location, we had everything we needed and then some. We will definitely stay here again!
beautiful house with amazing pond and river views. clean and updated. loved the kitchen and bathrooms. close to town but private.

Lia’s home was beautiful and had the perfect backyard for relaxing and playing with kids! The amenities from phone chargers, to kitchen supplies, to night lights, provided us with everything we needed and more! Would highly recommend this to anyone who wants a nice getaway that is close to restaurants and shops!

Just a note…wow.
We had an exceptional stay. The location is beautiful. The house was ultra clean and well laid out. Beautiful attention from the owners, to ensure a pleasant stay. Availability of 2 bikes which is a plus.
I would recommend it in a second.

Absolutely beautiful home! Lots of amenities, fantastic views of the river,comfortable furniture, elegant fixtures, first class kitchen, primary bedroom and bathroom were amazing. I’ve been to alot of AIRBNB properties …this was our favorite! Lia was fantastic …very responsive and helpful! Loved this home!

We had a small girls' weekend getaway to celebrate a close friend before getting married. We wanted a location where we could all hang out and enjoy eachothers company. This location was perfect. The house was beautiful, and everything we needed in the kitchen to prepare meals. We loved the big kitchen table, allowing us to enjoy meals together and play games. The water view was amazing. Gorgeous sunrises. The yard and deck were perfect to enjoy the lovely weather.

A beautiful, comfortable and clean home with great kitchen for making meals. The host, Lia, was quick to respond to requests and gave us great recommendations for walks, restaurants, etc. Our favorite part was the backyard and deck with a spectacular view of the water. So private and peaceful, we definitely want to return!

Best equipped Airbnb we've ever visited. Had everything you could imagine from kitchen equipment to bikes. Very clean and owner is immediately responsive. Location is essentially on a private lake with tons of wildlife. Back porch is divine. You don't ever have to leave! If you do, the town is only 4 minutes by car.

Very clean and tidy house, the view is amazing, you can see the lake from the living room, the house is at the end of the street, very quiet, not far from the shopping center, my friends and I are really super satisfied with this house, and will go again

Lia’s place is amazing! My family has stayed in Airbnbs all over the U.S., and this was one of the best experiences we have had. The house is gorgeous and stocked with everything you could need. My family of seven felt right at home here. Some of our favorite things were: waking to the sunrise over the river/pond, climbing the tree in the backyard, reading/napping in the gazebo, riding our bikes to downtown Cambridge, RAR brewing, and the short walk (or bike ride) to a local playground. We also did day trips to Assateague National Lakeshore and the Blackwater Wildlife Preserve — both of which were well worth the trip. This was also possibly the cleanest Airbnb we have ever stayed in and had everything we needed to stay in and cook for ourselves. If I could give more than five stars, I would!
The place was awesome and Lia was very responsive and extremely helpful.

I reserved Lia's place for a Team Retreat and I have to say it was absolutely GORGEOUS! The views alone were breathtaking, and the home was everything the listing said it would be. It was spotless, has beautiful views, fire-pit, friendly wildlife, and an Ah-mazing and fully stocked kitchen. Lia and Jeremy thought of it all and even had a printer on site with paper and ink for our use. My Team and I left feeling rejuvenated and cared for. I will be back for sure, maybe by myself next time to soak even more of it in. Book it!
We had a fantastic visit, the house was stunning and very comfortable.

What a gorgeous retreat! I came with 3 friends on a girlfriends getaway, and we were pleasantly surprised at how well appointed and spacious this beautiful home is - not to mention the absolutely incredible view.
The beds were so comfortable, great lighting, a relaxing wood burning fireplace. The place was huge, super clean, and not one amenity was missed. The attention to detail was apparent! Oh, and the record player was an awesome touch.
We enjoyed our morning coffee overlooking the Choptank River and Pinks Pond. The town is super close, so it was easy to pick up meals or cook together in the chef's dream kitchen.
The door separating the living area from the bedrooms was great, I never felt like I was disturbing the late risers.
We took the 5-minute drive into the quaint town of Cambridge for brunch and shopping. We also enjoyed staying in to walk the neighborhood and huge park overlooking the river. What a relaxing weekend, we will definitely be back!

We had a wonderful time at Lia and Jeremy’s house! The house was gorgeous and fully equipped with everything we might need. They are so well organized with all the instructions for the house, local recommendations, etc in one place! We would definitely stay there again!

We loved the home and location! Very peaceful and a great view. Lia has done a great job on setting up the home, everything we could have thought of (and more!) was there!
Very happy with our stay and looking at returning this spring!

This spot is absolutely stunning! The views of the river are incredible and the house is warm and inviting! Lia is a pleasure to book with. Downtown Cambridge has lots to offer with its quaint boutique shops and some very delicious restaurants. The area is quiet and private yet just 2 minutes from downtown. You will not be disappointed with your stay in this beautiful spot!

Very nice house and scene is beautiful.
This house has only one bathroom with a shower. So be mindful of this as this can be an inconvenience for some.

Lia & Jeremy’s home was the perfect Christmas getaway for me & my family! We found their home welcoming, clean, spacious, well stocked with toiletries and kitchen essentials, firewood, and personal touches throughout. The location and view (OMG the view!) provided the perfect quiet, cozy, and serene escape. Lia & Jeremy were excellent hosts! They were responsive and went above and beyond to make our stay a comfortable and memorable one. When the day arrived it really was hard to leave...but we will DEFINITELY be back!

Beautiful home with an amazing view! The perfect location for a small group getaway or family gathering. Lia and Jeremy are thoughtful hosts and provided all the necessary amenities to make us feel at home.

Lia is an incredible host with a truly beautiful home. She went above and beyond to care for us throughout our stay: quick responses to questions, a fully stocked kitchen, piles of firewood, aesthetically pleasing toiletries, seasonal decor, etc. the list goes on! 3 generations of my family stayed at the home and everyone found something to love. We hope to visit again soon and often!
Another excellent weekend in a beautifully located place and well-equipped house. Highly recommended!

We were looking for a peaceful, safe place a little bit away from town. This place was perfect. There's paddle craft access to little black water river. The place was clean and super nice. Will definitely stay again!
This was our 2nd time staying here! Wonderful as always comfy, cozy, and the views are wonderful! Very convenient to Blackwater as well as Cambridge. We will be back again!
This is a lovely little cabin on the river and near a small nature preserve/walking trail. Lisa is a great host and very responsive.
Perfect location for a trip to Blackwater refuge. Would love to come back!
A lovely peaceful stay close to Blackwater NWR, complete with kayaks!
Very nice. Love the farm and the Blackwater area
Lisa was a great host and very accommodating and responsive. The tiny house was very charming and cozy. I felt right at home. The house was also meticulously clean. 100% would recommend.

A beautiful site with all the amenities needed for a perfect getaway. Well equipped kitchen. Convenient location on the river with ability to launch our kayaks. The hostess was friendly, helpful and responsive. Plenty of space for two and we easily made it work for three adults with an air mattress. Farm.location is quiet and peaceful. Beautiful stargazing at night.
..

Had a great stay at Lisas place. Perfectly located for us to get in the water and do some kayak fishing. The tiny house was super clean and stocked. Met Lisas husband who was very welcoming. Will definitely return in the future on our next fishing trip to Blackwater!

We have stayed at the Little House a couple of times now, and it has always been a wonderful experience. Lisa and Pat are great hosts, and the accomodations are perfect for us. We look forward to our next visit.
This was our second stay at the tiny house, and it was as wonderful as the first. The house was clean and well stocked with necessities. Patrick and Lisa are terrific hosts.
The tiny house was beautiful. Would stay here again! The farm is amazing.
This was our fourth year staying here and it was great, as always. Hopefully, we'll be back next year!
The "Little House" provided the perfect home base for us as we visited family in the area during the holiday. We are anxious for our next visit.
This is a gem of a tiny house! Perfect for two people. Immaculate, peaceful, comfy bed, and a great host.
We absolutely love the little house on the farm! This was our 3rd visit and we'll be back again next year! Thanks for a great visit Lisa and Patrick.

Wonderful stay ! My son and I got to spend a week together in the perfect place for the two of us. Our hosts were friendly and the entire location was as described. We are hoping to book again next year.
We really enjoyed our visit and will definitely return. Mosquitoes were a little annoying but that’s to be expected in that area.

This is an absolutely perfect place to stay - the house looks just like the pictures, it is very cozy and comfortable, the entire house is immaculate, and the surrounding area is extremely peaceful and quiet. The house is a short distance to Blackwater Wildlife Refuge (the reason I was there) and Harriet Tubman National Park, and not far from restaurants and shopping. Lisa left the porch light on for me, knowing I may be arriving after dark, and messaged me shortly after arrival to make sure everything was satisfactory. The kitchen is well stocked with whatever is needed to cook meals at the house, although there is also a pretty comprehensive list of local restaurants and shopping, along with brochures of area attractions. It is obvious the hosts put a lot of thought into the comfort of their guests and providing whatever is needed during your stay. Absolutely fantastic Airbnb, and I will definitely return.

I absolutely loved loved loved this tiny home in the country. It was everything I expected. The home was lovely and relaxing and well appointed. Lisa even welcomed me with Happy Birthday letters under the tv which was so thoughtful. She even apologized for the tropical storm that put a damper on many of my plans.

This place is a real gem. It was tastefully decorated and upon entering the house, it just felt like home. Lisa is a great host and it's no wonder that she's a super host.
The house is a prime location for those looking to participate in the Ironman race.

We loved Lisa's place. It is very quiet, comfortable, and clean. She left us great suggestions for places to eat and things to do in the area. We borrowed the kayaks and explored the waterways around the house one afternoon which was incredibly convenient and saved us a ton in rental fees. The house was very comfortable and the kitchen has everything we needed. We'd definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this place to others.
Very peaceful and convenient location with direct water access to Blackwater Animal Refuge. I will be happy to come back here again!
Beautiful place and perfect for visiting Blackwater Refuge and Hooper’s Island.
My boyfriend and I had a great weekend! The house was so well decorated and had everything we needed. We also had a great time kayaking behind the house. We will definitely stay here again!
Second time visiting. Just as nice as the first! We look forward to spending another great weekend here next year. Thanks Lisa!

We are very enjoyed stay at Lisa’s little farm house. The host is very kind to offer us fresh towel during stay if we needed. Furthermore we have unexpected guest for a few days and she wouldn’t mind and explain where the extra bedding are. The decorating of the house feel so welcoming everywhere and the bedroom is outstanding. Thank you for let us enjoyed stay at your little farm house. We will be back and will recommend our friends to your little farm house.

Lisa is a wonderful host.
Just minutes from the refuge and from town

Perfect spot for a quaint Blackwater preserve getaway. We primarily stayed here to adventure in the park and got exactly what we were looking for: easy access to the water with host provided kayaks, 10 minutes biking from the entire preserve, and a comfy place to rest our heads at night after enjoying the park. There’s a pair of cranes who appear to live right by the house!
The house is clean, well furnished and relaxing. The surroundings are really beautiful and calming with great sunsets!

I think I have stayed at the tiny house a half-dozen times.
Lisa is the perfect host! If you want privacy, that's what you'll get. If you, like me, have questions about the area or the workings of the farm, she is more than happy to share her wealth of information!
Very quiet, very clean.
We were lucky enough to be there when the wheat was being harvested. Such a treat for city people like us. There were trucks and combines, but we barely heard either.

We thoroughly enjoyed staying at Lisa’s property! The house was clean and exactly what the listing showed and described. The actual property where the house was located was amazing! Also, Lisa is a great host that is quick to respond and willing to go the extra mile for her guests. We will definitely be back!
Lisa was probably the easiest person I’ve ever booked through! She was very helpful and responded quickly to any questions I had. Will book again next year!
Lisa place is awesome, so nice. Clean and updated. They were wonderful and accommodating

Such acute, quiet, and quaint little spot. Super easy to find, easy to get in, all in all it was an amazing time. great to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and just enjoy some peace and quiet and the surrounding nature.

This was our second stay at the tiny house, it was so good the first time, we had to come back. As before, Lisa and her husband are incredibly friendly and always responsive. The tiny house offers modern amenities in a small cozy space surrounded by beautiful eastern shore scenery.
The best part about this trip? This time, we left ENGAGED! So now this location will always hold a special place in our hearts. ☺️

I love this place! Far better value than a hotel and an excellent base of operations for exploring Blackwater. If Lisa will have me back, I will become a yearly regular at her place. Enthusiastically recommended!

All my expectations were exceeded at the relaxing tiny house in rural Dorchester County. The house is perfect, serene and adorable on the grounds of a working farm and along lightly trafficked roads ideal for bicycling. Lovely views of the countryside. Very zen.

What a wonderful place to stay. Laid back and beautiful scenery. Lisa was very helpful and communicated perfectly! So close to Blackwater as well as Cambridge for all your needs. 10/10 would recommend and will be back!
Excellent Airbnb! The best one around Blackwater NWR. The place was spotless. The location was very convenient. Thank you!
Great place to stay for the weekend. Very close to Blackwater Refuge. Place was very clean and quiet. Very good communication. Would stay there again.
Clean and very relaxing.

We were return guests and can't wait till our next visit. The "Little House on the Farm" is so perfect for two. We love the setting and was welcomed by an eagle fishing in the pond one morning. We were taking pictures of wildlife before we even started the car to tour Blackwater Refuge. We highly recommend staying here.

It’s impossible to say just a few words because it was so wonderful! So here goes. During Covid when we were all homebound I would look through Air BnB’s and dream of all the places I would visit. This home was on the list. Turning into the lane, then opening the front door I realized dreams do come true! What a joy it was to experience all there is to see and do in this beautiful county. Then to come home at the end of day and stay at this lovely home. It may say it’s a little house. Let me tell you this little home delivers in a mighty big way. I would think of something I needed and there it was at my fingertips. The beautiful decor, and the sense of peace it gave you. A goods nights rest and expectations of another great day. They say a house is made of brick and stone but a home is built on love alone. This little home is big on love. Grateful most of all for such wonderful host and their gift of hospitality that they share so generously with others.
Great stay at a unique location very close to great trails in the Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge.

This is an adorable place to stay. The farm setting is peaceful, beautiful, and right on the doorstep of Blackwater Wildlife Refuge. My husband and I were there specifically for the Refuge. Being able to be that close was perfect. The house had everything we needed to be comfortable and make meals. More than enough room for the two of us. We enjoyed the quiet and peace. Sitting on the dock out back to watch the geese was an added bonus. We didn't miss the WIFI and cable. It's a nice chance to just unplug and get back to nature. We will definitely be back.

The Little House on the Farm met my expectations and then some. I loved being able to take nature walks along water and around fields going right outside the door. Not having to drive a car for several days was a true vacation. I was able to calm down my city anxieties and get into a rhythm of reading, writing, meditating which is exactly what I intended. I imagine that in warmer months with kayaking available would make the place even more desirable. I only spoke with Lisa on the phone and she was always prompt and helpful. This place actually fits the description.
Beautiful house and a beautiful property
This is the third time we've stayed in the Tiny House. It is such a great little place in a great spot for birding and exploring. It is clean, well-kept and Lisa is a great host.

Lisa's place was great! We booked this place for its accessibility to Blackwater Refuge for a birdwatching trip and were thrilled with the easy access to Blackwater. A bonus, it's so close that you can see birds from the airbnb's windows as you're getting ready in the morning - we saw a bald eagle from the window Saturday morning! Cambridge MD isn't too far away (about 15 min) and is a nice small town with some good eating options. The house was thoughtfully appointed and had everything we needed; I especially liked the heater in every room, including the bathroom, since I get cold. We had a great stay and would definitely stay again!

What a treasure! We got there later than expected but Lisa had the light on and we entered from a long drive and meetings all day to the most peaceful farmhouse. From the warm fall candle scent when we arrived to the warm cozy heaters, well appointed furniture and peacefully decorated accessories all on a beautiful piece of land. It was exactly what we wanted for a weekend sanctuary to relax and unwind. You don’t want to miss Black Water Bakery. We went Saturday for breakfast and lunch. Ava’s Pizzeria for dinner and back to Black Water for lunch Sunday before we left. I give this air b&b a 10/10! We will send our family and friends for sure!

Absolutely amazing stay. Lisa and Pat are excellent hosts who were very attentive to anything I asked for. Their tiny house on the farm was perfect for me. Access to the Blackwater was great as was access to Cambridge. The home does not have cable, wifi, internet access so, as long as you come knowing that (it's in the home description) you will love the place as I did. Unplugged, off the grid, and quiet with amazing hosts!

We enjoyed the tiny house so much for our weekend getaway! Everything was clean and well maintained, which made it great to spend time in when we weren’t out and about. Being very quiet was a plus and made us feel isolated but comfortable. Lisa was fantastic to work with, making sure to answer any questions and make sure everything was set for our stay (including fire wood for us to use!). We will definitely make an effort to visit the area, and stay here again if we can!

This place is fantastic. The home is even nicer than the pictures. With a sitting room, bedroom and full-size kitchen, it's very comfortable. There are lights everywhere you want them, including sconces behind the bed's headboard – perfect for reading in bed.
If you are interested in the natural beauty and history of the area, the Tiny House is centrally located to everything. Stay awhile and do it all; the landscape is mesmerizing. In the Tiny House you almost feel like part of it because it is situated on a working farm. While I was there, they were harvesting (corn, it looked like), but a guest could still come and go, launch a kayak (you'd have to bring your own), and watch the herons float on by.

Lisa went above and beyond to make sure our stay at the Little House was perfect. The Little House was perfectly located and had all the necessities to make it a great vacation. We had such a great time visiting the Blackwater Refuge

So thankful that this wonderful little place was available again!! It was just as great as the 1st time!! It’s on a Beautiful Historic Farmland!! Clean & stocked with everything you’d need to relax!! Close to Cambridge & all that it has to offer!! Lisa & Pat are wonderful host!!
The tiny house on the farm did not disappoint. Lisa thought of all the little things to make us feel at home. A perfect distance from town and a great place to stay for Ironman Maryland.

Great hosts and a great stay. The farm property is quiet and peaceful. The tiny home is cozy and supplies much that is needed, from recommendations to pots and pans to cook a favorite dish. Great access to a body of water for kayaking or fishing. Kind hosts!

What a gem!! We just loved this place. Great location for the Blackwater Refuge, Harriett Tubman sites, and strolling in the town of Cambridge. It’s a tiny house but absolutely comfortable and has everything you need. Will be back.

Great place to stay! Exactly as it was pictured! Homey, comfortable, very clean and perfect weekend getaway. If your in the area and looking for a place, it’s a must stay. Quick 10 min drive to downtown Cambridge if you are looking for places to grab a drink or dinner. Lisa was extremely quick to communicate and would accommodate any request. Would definitely return!
The Tiny House was perfect as usual! We kayaked and took a guided fishing trip from Blackwater Adventures and snagged 3 huge snakehead. Thank you Lisa and Patrick we love visiting your farm!!
Wonderful host and wonderful stay. We will be back!
The tiny house on the farm was absolutely just perfect. It was so clean, decorated brilliantly and had everything you needed. We will most definitely be back. Thank you!
We loved our stay and recommend the tiny house to anyone looking for a great weekend base at the Blackwater Refuge area.

Very clean quiet just want I was looking for!!
What a great weekend

Absolutely speechlessly incredible home, and even better HOSTS! It is clear that Lisa and Pat put such care, attention, and hospitality into every detail of their guests stay. From little things like making sure cozy blankets are set up by the DVD player for movie night, to bigger things like making sure all the essentials are stocked in the house (including a million extra pillows, washcloths, pots/pans, Tupperware, coffee, EASTERN SHORE spices, you name it!!), and to even BIGGER things like setting up our outdoor adventures with a ready-to-light fire pit and taking the time to check on the rivers’ water level to see if we could kayak (thank you again Pat for spending your Sunday doing that for us!!). And on top of all that, Lisa pretty much planned our entire itinerary weekend with her amazing suggestions the whole month leading up to the weekend (thanks for answering all my questions Lisa!) and then has so many pamphlets and even a binder of fun things to do once we got into the house. Amazing!
But besides the incredible care and hospitality, the house and property itself are just breathtaking. If you want to stay in, the home is skillfully decorated to feel like a larger space than it is, and it’s super comfy indoors with fantastic ac units that hold the temperature to perfection. If you’d rather stay nearby and just want to explore the property, it is so quiet and private and perfect for bird watching or kayaking. Or, if you want to go out you’re super close to downtown Cambridge for amazing restaurants and water views (definitely recommend Rar brewery and Blackwater Bakery next door!). The great thing is though, you are close to town but feels like you’re out there on your own. (For single women: perfect place to stay if you want to feel like you’re staying away and “out there” because it feels so quiet and private, but Lisa and Pat are right next door if you need them for anything!)
Overall, this place is just something so special. Overall, these people are just something so special. I highly recommend the tiny home over any other “resort” in the area! Thank you for everything Lisa and Pat!

Our 4th time at the Little House! Still as perfect as the first time we stayed. Very quiet. Very clean!
The area is lovely in any season, but there's so much to do in the summer with Blackwater NWR and kayak rentals 5 minutes away!
Lisa is a great host - responsive but not intrusive.

I had not intended to book a place without wifi or laundry (don’t make reservations until you’re caffeinated friends!). I was a bit bummed when I realized what I had done. However, after staying here, I do not regret it one bit! Lisa could not have been a better host. As a note: there are laundromats in Cambridge, and Verizon wireless works well, so I just used my phone as my hotspot.
Her place is spacious, clean, and very well provisioned! I have stayed in AirBnBs in 6 countries, and this is one of my all time favorites. There are enough dishes and cooking utensils for 4 people. She also provides lots of cleaning supplies (not all hosts do). She cautions guests that it may be noisy due to being a working farm, but we did not experience that (it’s summer, and the AC units provide background noise). However, the bugs are no joke (I got 18 bites THOUGH my pants on a windy night). She communicates very well and is super respectful of your space. Anyone we spoke to in the area told us how lovely they were, and we agree!
Great location! Great Little House! Highly recommended.
The tiny house was more than we expected, beautiful and clean and close enough to everything in Cambridge and the surrounding area, really amazing!

The Little House on the Farm is such a delight and a gift for those visiting the area. It’s right next door to Blackwater Refuge which is a gem of a place for birders, photographers, kayakers, bikers, etc.
It is quite obvious that Lisa takes extremely good care of her place and is thoughtful about what makes a place relaxing and welcoming.
Thanks again Lisa for a wonderful time! We don’t need to look further and will always choose to stay at The Little House when in the area, if available!
Beautiful farm location with its own resident heron. Our hosts were fantastic and the house is so cute and well designed. Close to vineyard, fishing, trails, and Cambridge.

This was our third stay at the little house and it was just as great as our first. Very clean, not-too-small, space in a gorgeous area. Very quiet, with lots of birds and wildlife in the immediate area - Blackwater NWR is minutes away. Two mature eagles flew over while I was having coffee this morning and the osprey put on a show.
We were lucky enough to watch the combine reap the wheat across the road. It was better than TV for us city folk!
Lisa is a fabulous host. Doesn't intrude but is just a text or steps away.
Will return yet again!
Great spot, right on the farm and only a short drive away from the Blackwater wildlife refuge. The house looks tiny on the outside but feels big on the inside.
Absolutely amazing town had such a great time the house was spotless,decorated so sweetly,10 out of 10!

The tiny house had everything I needed for a great stay. The location is beautiful and very close to Cambridge where I was commuting for work. I got great trail running recommendations. It was nice to have a home away from home!
We had a great stay at Lisa’s tiny house. It was clean, quaint, and perfect for our stay.

We had a lovely stay here! Everything was very clean and safe which allowed us to feel calm and peaceful during our visit. Check in was simple and any communication was quick. The space (inside and out) was well cared for. 10/10 would recommend staying here!

What a hidden gem. Our stay exceeded our expectations and Lisa was so wonderful. This is now our go to in the Cambridge area.
I would love to give the "Little House on the Farm" 10 stars.
Lisa is the best! Her house was so nice and accommodating!
Lisa is an excellent host and very accommodating. We loved the tiny house it had everything we needed for a weekend get away.
Great place on a quiet farm out away from the town lights. Hosts were great and communication was excellent. The house was clean and comfortable.

The Little House on the Farm is ideally situated to take advantage of both the Blackwater Wildlife Refuge and all Cambridge has offer. We loved the quiet isolation of the farm and the accommodations were second to none.

This is a perfectly positioned little gem for anyone visiting Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge or the surrounding area. A great little launching place for exploring the area, all fresh and clean and comfortable. Great communications, clear directions, quiet setting just a few minutes from Blackwater and the surrounding trails and launches.
Amazing, comfortable, and has everything you need. It’s so close to everything and it’s peaceful!
This is a plenty spacious spot to enjoy the natural beauty and remoteness of the Blackwater area.
A cozy and comfortable place for one or two, remote and quiet. Lisa has thoughtfully prepared and maintained this gem of a space. Looking forward to return visits!

Great location for exploring Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge. Also close to Cambridge and some very good restaurants. Lisa is an excellent host. The tiny house is lovely and clean and had everything we needed for our weekend stay. The location on the farm offers some fantastic views of changing weather.

The Tiny House on the Farm is the perfect home base to enjoy all that Dorchester County has to offer: great food, history, biking, paddling, and more. The house is clean and comfortable, and it is evident that Lisa put a lot of thought and care into decorating this house. After a day of biking the local roads or paddling one of the many paddling options, we enjoyed coming back to the house and sitting outside by the fire, or sitting on the sofa and enjoying the view out the front door (one morning, a bald eagle flew by right in front of the door). Lisa's seemingly unlimited knowledge of the area led us to the best crab cakes and tuna tacos we've ever experienced. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Second time stay and it's still immaculately clean. Like, you could eat off the floor clean. We stayed over the Christmas holiday and the tiny house was festively decorated and included homemade cookies!
Lisa is very responsive to all questions; a perfect host.
This is our second time staying here. It is a great little house in a perfect location for Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge. The house is really nice and spotlessly clean. Lisa is a great host.

We had a wonderrul stay at the tiny house. Wanted to be near Blackwater Wildlife Refuge, as biking there was the focus of our trip. We enjoyed having our own space and a refrigerator. Nice to be out in the country.
The house is lovely. Lots of amenities. Very quiet and private, of course.
Amazing place to stay feels like home

Since I'm local and renovating my house it was a great place to stay with privacy and close to home so my girlfriend could see where I'm from. Riding by the farm occasionally I truly thought the pictures were deceiving but it's much roomier than I imagined. Very comfortable and very well decorated. Allyson absolutely loves it. I wouldn't have expected any less knowing the family. Versus a hotel to stay near home, we will definitely be back after my next tugboat hitch in 3 weeks. Thanks for everything. Wish we could have gotten a chance to catch up more.
the tiny house is very nice and I would highly recommend it to anyone needing a place to stay in the area.
Tiny little piece of rural paradise. Beautiful tiby home with everything we needed to just relax and enjoy.
Really nice, clean place and the owner went the extra mile letting me check in a little early
I really enjoyed my stay. The place was extremely clean, comfortable, had all of the amenities I needed and was conveniently-located. I look forward to a return stay at some point in the future.

We can't think of a better place to stay for a few days or even weeks! The "tiny" house is perfect for two - tastefully designed and furnished, simply and comfortably laid out, clean and efficient with everything one needs. While perched on the edge of a large working farm, it is quiet and peaceful, and the business of the farm is a fascinating sidelight. Have a talk, if you can, with one of the farming family and discover or rediscover a hard, but deeply rewarding way of life. Take advantage also of the river and refuge - there is nothing quite like it anywhere else in our part of the country. And don't miss out on the host's warm and welcoming hospitality!
amazing place to stay: Quiet, clean and great host. I will definitely keep this place on the top of my list next time I go to the area

Lisa's place is a great location for a stay in Blackwater. It is also not far from Cambridge. During our stay we fished in the backyard and bridges around the place. Very convenient for a fishing trip. Lisa was a great host as well. The place looks like a little cabin from airbnb but has everything including utensils, plates, stove, fireplace, etc.

The Little House is a remarkable retreat on a beautiful farm. There were no farm activities to disturb the quiet country setting. It is just minutes to both the Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad National Historical Park and Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge - neither should be missed during a visit.

We were in town for Ironman Maryland and this tiny home served as the perfect base camp. I’d highly recommend staying here to anyone looking for a quiet getaway just outside of Cambridge. We also had a great time kayaking just outside the front door!

We stayed here for a weekend getaway and had a great time. It’s a cozy little house that’s a short drive away from Cambridge and an even shorter drive to the wildlife preserve.
The hosts were excellent and check in and out was a simple and smooth process.

Blackwater Refuge- Kayaking launch!
I needed a short getaway, I love kayaking but didn't bring my own. Lisa was kind enough to let us use her kayaks. There's a launch right on the property. the house itself was immaculate. it was quaint, clean, and comfortable. Lisa was responsive to my many questions from the moment I booked my stay. I would definitely recommend this stay and will come back for a weekend away on Blackwater again! Thank you kindly!

We enjoyed our stay at the Little House. It was clean and comfortable and very thoughtfully decorated. The close proximity to Blackwater was a real plus. The lack of WiFi was a plus for us. We hope to return in the fall to catch the migratory birds. If you’re planning a trip to Cambridge or Blackwater we highly recommend the Little House.

The location was so peaceful and quiet - the perfect getaway to refresh from my busy life. The place was soooo clean and cozy as well! My friend & I really enjoyed our stay. The location was also super close to the Refuge (highly recommend to visit there!). Highly recommend this place!

Wonderful accommodations, very clean! Beautiful details in the ‘tiny house’. We enjoyed our stay and we loved the surrounding area. Hope to be back so we can kayak and hike around! Thank you for the great stay!

Super clean not-that-little space! Very cute with enough room to stretch out. Kitchen had everything needed to cook a meal, including some basics in the cupboard. The bathroom and shower are pristine!! Comfy bed. The farm is lovely and only 5 minutes from BNWR entrance.
No WiFi, but the Verizon signal is very strong - I was able to do Zoom meetings with no lag.
Lisa is very quick to answer any questions!

Lisa’s place was AMAZING.
I am from Maryland but have never been to this part. I wanted a get away with my partner where we could be away from the noise but still find things to do.
Firstly the space is bigger than you think by reading “tiny home” but it is plenty for two people.
The kitchen has everything we needed, living room was spacious (if they had a bigger tv I would have been stuck lol) but we found plenty to do outside, and the bed was amazing.
Natural light made its way in despite the large beautiful trees they have so I still got my content. There is no WiFi so I used my data but my partner did not have hardly any internet, she didn’t mind but keep this in mind if you must be on your phone/laptop.
We did not get to use the kayaks but they were there so hopefully you can if the water permits! Lisa gave us bikes and we rode EVERYWHERE.
I can definitely say our favorite part was star gazing at night. We parked my car and laid out and saw so many shooting stars (possibly an alien or two; unconfirmed atm). Thank you so much Lisa, can’t wait to post these clips to my TikTok & IG! @iamorlandojames 😁
Lisa and Patrick’s home was very quaint and lovely. We enjoyed relaxing and the activities around town. If we ever go back, which we intend to, we are definitely staying in the Tiny House :)

We had a fantastic stay at the tiny house. It was very spacious as well as super clean. The kayaks are a nice touch and gives you something to do in your free time. It was located fairly close to shopping centers and just 2 miles from the Wildlife refuge. If you’re looking for a great place to stay for a getaway in Maryland this is it! Definitely enjoyed our trip and will look to stay here again in the future

This is a wonderful place to stay near Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge, Cambridge MD, and the environs. Peaceful, beautiful farm setting with easy access to birdwatching, kayaking, biking, and sightseeing. Downtown Cambridge is only about 15 minutes away. One thing to know is that the "Little House" is really not that little and is quite a comfortable size for two people. Very clean and well maintained, with all the amenities you could need.

Great stay with just the right friendly privacy we enjoy. Comfortable, with everything we could want in the Little House and decorated with great taste too! Definitely planning to come back as soon as 2022 dates open up. The location is perfect with easy access to Cambridge, Blackwater Refuge, the Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad Museum, and other historic sites. We didn’t use the available kayaks due to the heat and insects but would love to next time!

The tiny house was beautifully decorated and provided plenty of space for two people to stay. The area is gorgeous and quiet. There is everything you could need at the house and anything else you could want is just a close distance away. My husband and I loved everything about our stay here and would love to stay here again.
Beautiful place about 15 minutes from town to give you peace and quiet. One of the cleanest and cutest places you will probably get to stay at. Perfect to travel to so many different locations!

I decided to book the tiny house as a surprise long weekend birthday trip for my girlfriend and we had an amazing experience. For anyone who loves outdoors activities such as kayaking, biking, and walking while exploring beautiful Eastern Shore landscapes, this is the place for you. The tiny house is located very conveniently to plenty of activities near Blackwater Refuge. The interior or the tiny house is absolutely gorgeous and very comfortable. The owners, Lisa and Patrick, go above and beyond to make the stay enjoyable. We had an awesome experience and plan to return in the future.

Our recent five night stay in the little house on the farm was a wonderful experience from start to finish. For two guests it is surprisingly spacious, we never felt cramped, even after spending a rainy afternoon indoors. The house is very clean, nicely decorated, comfortable temperature and is situated on a lovely property. Whether you want to kayak or just enjoy the wildlife from the dock, the water access is a wonderful feature. It is the best of both worlds, immersed in nature and just minutes away from towns with dining opportunities and museums to learn about an area steeped in historical significance. The hosts are respectful of your privacy and a joy to converse with. A great vacation!
Great and comfortable stay on the eastern shore! The tiny home is close to downtown via car or bike! The hosts are on site and have great recommendations for activities around town.
Lisa's place was just as advertised! It was a perfect size for the two of us. Her farm was quiet and easy to find. The tiny house is very cute and nicely decorated! We would definitely come back!
Good stay
This house is perfect for a nice getaway. So cozy and peaceful. The host is lovely and accessible at all times. I enjoyed my stay and will definitely be returning.
This is a quiet, charming little house on a farm that you can see stars at night because it’s dark enough. It is perfect for city dwellers to get away for the weekend.

If you are looking for a place to go for relaxation and beautiful surroundings, the "little house" on the farm fits the bill. Lisa is a host willing to help in any way she can to make your stay enjoyable. The interior of the house is done in colors and decor that create a warm and comfy experience. A list of restaurants and places to visit also add to your overall experience. This Airbnb is a spot I will revisit in the future.

Lisa’s place is really great! It is just as pictured. Well appointed, nicely decorated, and super clean, which is important to us! We were looking to bike Dorchester County and this was the perfect location to ride out the drive to Blackwater Wildlife Refuge, or to explore points beyond. This is a bike friendly area, so go for it! Lisa is perfectly responsive. We highly recommend the little house on the farm!

Perfect location for easy access to Blackwater Refuge. The "tiny house" was well equipped, clean and beautifully decorated. We enjoyed the peaceful setting on the farm. After launching our canoe from the property's bank, we spent a relaxing day fishing and bird watching. While on the farm we spotted deer, fox, bunnies, turtles and eagles. Lisa responded immediately to our inquires and provided a private escape from the hustle and bustle.

Our stay with Lisa was top notch from beginning to end! The small house was really not all that small, and it was just as depicted in the photos, only better.
Perfectly clean, quiet and a great base for us to explore the Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge and the various Harriet Tubman historical sites. Both are very close and Cambridge is just a short drive away as well.
Communication was excellent and Lisa answered our questions promptly and fully.
We hope to return, thanks so much Lisa for everything, a very memorable stay.

Beautifully decorated, designed for comfort, and placed in the ideal location. Oh, and I can’t forget to mention the fabulous hosts who go out of their way to accommodate.
The Blackwater Wildlife Area is a very special place for us, a place to enjoy nature, ride bikes, kayak, enjoy great food or do nothing at all. This house was perfectly located to put us in the middle of everything we love about the area.
As mentioned, there is no WiFi, but if you can’t go a few days without it, then you probably don’t get what makes this area soooo special.
We cannot wait to return.
Perfect spot. Great access to the town. Lisa and Pat are fantastic folks.
Great little house on a beautiful farm-immaculate and comfortable! Friendly hosts! Kayak rental right down the road. Cambridge is close and has nice restaurants. Next time we will bring bicycles!
Great location for exploring the Black Water Wildlife Refuge. Has everything you need for a home base.
A very pleasant place to stay while visiting Blackwater NWR. Super convenient to the Refuge. The house was cozy and perfectly maintained. Highly recommended!

If you’re looking for a place to go to relax & enjoy some of what the country life has to offer, this is your place!! Located on a beautiful farm not far from Cambridge! This location is perfect for those that want to travel around Dorchester County & enjoy all that it has to offer! Felt great to be back in the country & to be around nature!! Lisa is an amazing host! This Airbnb was the cleanest most practical we’ve ever stayed in!!!
our stay was lovely and relaxing. The tiny house on the farm was very enjoyable and met our needs. Warm and welcoming and taken care of. Great location for being on eastern shore of Maryland.

Our 3-night stay at the "Little House on the Farm" exceeded our expectations. First and foremost, this house did not seem "little". It's cozy, sure, but it's plenty large for 2 people and we never felt crowded. It's actually 3 rooms: An eat-in kitchen attached to the main living area (with couch and arm-chair), separate bedroom, and full-size bathroom with large shower. The house is on a secluded farm, located across from the main house, and near a large pond. The house appears to be recently constructed and is in fine shape, very clean, and comfortably furnished. The built-in electric heating unit did a fine job of keeping the entire place warm. Lots of natural sunlight during the day and good lighting in all the rooms for the night. Window blinds for privacy. No wi-fi (we knew this ahead) but the signal for Verizon cell service is strong. If you like nature, the Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge is a mile down the road and has several good hiking trails (short and moderate length) and a drive-through nature road. We spent a full day there and got to see bald eagles in their nest. (Bring binoculars!) All in all, this was a great place to go for a socially-distanced get-away. We both highly recommend the "Little House on the Farm" .

We loved staying at Lisa and Pat's little house on the farm. It is perfectly located for exploring Blackwater NWR at all times of day, as well as convenient for an outdoor lunch in Cambridge. The house is very clean and well equipped with everything we needed for a weekend away from the city. Lisa was very responsive and helpful in answering all of our questions. We can't wait to stay again on our next visit to Blackwater NWR!
This place was perfect. Thank you!
Lovely, comfortable little house in a great location for birding and exploring. The little house is beautiful inside and the location is quiet and pretty. Lisa is an excellent, communicative host.

We stayed a few days over the thanksgiving holiday. We wanted a quiet few days and had never been to this area. The Little House was perfect. On the inside it’s beautiful and comfortable. We really loved everything about it. The chess board and cards came in handy. The tv gets three channels which for this trip was totally fine. We enjoyed driving and hiking in the area.
Lisa gave us so many great trips for the area. The food we ate in this trip was some of the best. Bombay Tadka, Old Salty for thanksgiving, Snappers... the mugs were a perfect touch as well.
We would totally recommend this and go back.

Lisa’s little house on a farm was just what I needed to celebrate another trip around the sun. She communicated promptly to every message. The home was spotless clean and thoughtfully appointed, equipped with every comfort needed for my stay. The farm is as breathtaking in person as it is in photos. Thanks Lisa for providing the perfect respite!

This house is perfect for a quiet getaway. It is situated in a gorgeous natural setting close to the Blackwater Refuge and Chesapeake Bay. It is very private, clean and tastefully decorated in a modern farmhouse theme—quite adorable! Responses were immediate from our hosts.

Had a wonderful time at Lisa and Pat’s this past weekend. Very comfortable place and even better location! Looking forward to the next time back!
Thanks again guys!!

Very comfortable place to stay away from the hustle and bustle. Well equipped kitchen if you planning on doing some cooking. Perfect location to stay if you’re going to the Blackwater wildlife refuge.

Lovely tiny house exactly as pictured near the Little Blackwater River. The house is beautifully decorated and very comfortable, the kitchen and bath have nice touches, and the bedroom is very comfortable. Various brochures and maps for bicycling, paddling, and local history are provided in the house. The somewhat rainy weekend did not allow me to kayak or sit outside to enjoy the sunset so I hope to visit again though weather cooperated long enough for a nice bike ride at nearby Blackwater National Refuge and the local roads. I also drove by car along the Harriett Tubman Underground Railway byway listening to the audio guide on the free mobile phone app. The historic town center in Cambridge has some nice restaurants such as Theo’s, RAR Brewing, and Vintage 414.

This place is a gem! It's located on a beautiful farm with a lake, about 15 minutes from Cambridge. The views are spectacular. The hosts are very responsive and helpful. I'd highly recommend staying here!

My husband and I had a great time at Lisa’s tiny house on the farm. It was very clean, very cute and she even left me a birthday cake as she knew we were traveling to celebrate my birthday. She was very communicative and very quick to respond. Overall we had a lovely time and hope to go back!

My wife and I really enjoyed our time at the Little House on The Farm. The house was cozy and nicely decorated just like the pictures. It was also well equipped with everything we needed to make breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The surrounding area made the perfect backdrop for our impromptu photoshoot, it was beautiful. Lisa and her husband Patrick were great hosts, making sure we had everything we needed to enjoy our little adventures. Communicating with them was very easy and quick. We highly recommend this place!
Lisa went above and beyond to make sure my spouse and I had an awesome wedding anniversary trip, and even left us champagne and a cake! The lake is also gorgeous.

We had a lovely stay at the "tiny house". The house was well appointed and the kitchen and bathroom were well equipped. The farm is beautiful and the location is great for access to the wildlife refuge or to put your kayaks in. Lisa was quick to respond to any messages and was good about checking in with us. We would be happy to stay there again if we're back in the area. Thanks again for a great stay!

This was a great spot for kayaking and biking. Paddling from the house was fun and there are many put-in spots nearby. The house is very comfortable and has everything you'll need for a relaxing stay. Lisa offered great dining suggestions and was very quick to respond to questions. We'll be back soon, I hope!

Lisa's Tiny House was easy to find and very close to Blackwater Wildlife Refuge. It's also a short drive into downtown Cambridge. Travelling in the time of COVID-19, we were looking for a place that was a little more isolated and this place worked great. Check-in was super easy and contactless, and we were able to enjoy our 2 nights there without any issues. Clean, modern, well appointed, and remote. It was a nice place to relax, a nice change of scenery, and Lisa was a perfect host.
Great place. Wonderful hosts. Very quiet. Loved my short stay. Will definitely check and see if available next time I head to thpe area

The Little House on the Farm is strongly recommended for a visit to the Blackwater National Wildlife Refuge. Across the lawn is the BWR water! The house is spotlessly clean and completely equipped. The location is very quiet and peaceful and you're smack in the middle of the Eastern Shore's wet low-country. The owners are very friendly, thoughtful and ready to assist in any way. Fantastic place.

My husband and I stayed here as part of a long weekend to see more of the eastern side of Maryland.
The location is away from the usual hustle and bustle and located right next to water access, which gives some lovely views even from the accommodation. The farm grounds made a relaxing and scenic location to unwind.
The accommodation itself was sparklingly clean and fully kitted for the majority of stays. There were toiletries, coffee-making supplies and tons of extra luxuries which really made our stay extra special.
The host, Lisa, was particularly attentive and responsive - giving us lots of helpful recommendations on where to visit and making sure our stay was as comfortable as possible. She really went the extra mile for us and we would definitely stay here again if we were in the area. What an amazing place!

A restful week away in a beautifully appointed little house on the Farm. Full of comfort and charm, Lisa provided for even the little details. Easy access to nature trails, kayaking,bird watching, and choice of restaurants. A great place to stay for an overnight or several days. Thanks so much!

My friend and I spent three nights at Lisa's house and had a wonderful experience. She is an amazing, super responsive host. She made us feel welcome and offered excellent suggestions. The house is well appointed and it was the perfect place to get away for a few days.

My wife and I enjoyed a 2 night stay at the little house and had a wonderful time. The place was sparkling clean and even though they have only been renting for a few months, the attention to the little things showed. The kitchen is well equipped with plenty of teas and coffee. The bathroom was stocked with soaps and shampoos and plenty of soft towels. We enjoyed walking around the farm early in the morning with our coffee and watching the sun rise over the silos. There is water access right out the door and took advantage several times to relish in the quietness. We will definitely visit again!

We absolutely loved our stay. Lisa really went above and beyond as a host--we appreciated her thoughtful communications with us, and all of her recommendations were really helpful. We loved that she had a very detailed binder full of information on local attractions and dining. The space itself was absolutely lovely. It was very clean, cool, and cozy. Lisa provided some mini toiletries just like a hotel, and the kitchen was well stocked with staple cooking ingredients, coffee, and bottled water. There's no wifi, but there is a TV with a DVD player and a nice selection of movies. We also loved the location. The farm was just lovely and it wasn't far from many restaurants in town, kayaking/Black Water Wildlife Refuge, and the Harriet Tubman Museum (closed at least right now due to COVID-19 but we'll have to come back). The house is also only about 1.5 hours from the beach, so a beach day trip is easy from there. Overall, this was the perfect getaway for us, and we would stay there again!

A renovated modular office turned into a spectacular modern farm house getaway. It was cleverly done, and cozy, yet spacious, too. She greeted us on arrival, and we had a comfortable stay while we were looking at properties in the area. The design and furnishings were beautiful, and it was spotlessly clean. We couldn’t have been more pleased. This is a new AirBnb and I can wholeheartedly recommend it!

Lisa's "Tiny House" was lovely to stay at. We ended up picking it last minute, but are so glad we did. It was beautifully decorated-- very new and modern, but still cozy. It was absolutely spotless when we got there as well. The kitchen was well stocked with what we needed in order to cook a few basic meals, the only thing we didn't have was a corkscrew, not a big deal. If we are ever back in the area, we would definitely stay there again. I cannot recommend enough for anyone else considering it; it's one of the nicest Airbnbs we've seen.

Lisa and Patrick were amazing hosts. This was our first trip post-covid and we could not have asked for a cleaner stay / better experience. We were the first people to stay in the "Little Home on the farm" and the space was beautiful. Lisa was extremely attentive and strove to make our experience the best possible. For example, she provided us with many local recommendations for food, attractions, and activities.
